98 // Blocks that are in flight, and that are in the queue to be downloaded.
99 // Protected by cs_main.
100 struct QueuedBlock {
101  uint256 hash;
102  int64_t nTime; // Time of "getdata" request in microseconds.
103  int nQueuedBefore; // Number of blocks in flight at the time of request.
104 };
105 map<uint256, pair<NodeId, list<QueuedBlock>::iterator> > mapBlocksInFlight;
106 map<uint256, pair<NodeId, list<uint256>::iterator> > mapBlocksToDownload;
107 }

118 struct CMainSignals {
119  // Notifies listeners of updated transaction data (passing hash, transaction, and optionally the block it is found in.
120  boost::signals2::signal<void (const CTransaction &, const CBlock *, bool)> SyncTransaction;
121  // Notifies listeners of an erased transaction (currently disabled, requires transaction replacement).
122  boost::signals2::signal<void (const uint256 &)> EraseTransaction;
123  // Notifies listeners of an updated transaction without new data (for now: a coinbase potentially becoming visible).
124  boost::signals2::signal<void (const uint256 &)> UpdatedTransaction;
125  // Notifies listeners of a new active block chain.
126  boost::signals2::signal<void (const CBlockLocator &)> SetBestChain;
127  // Notifies listeners about an inventory item being seen on the network.
128  boost::signals2::signal<void (const uint256 &)> Inventory;
129  // Tells listeners to broadcast their data.
130  boost::signals2::signal<void (bool)> Broadcast;
131 } g_signals;
132 }

134 void RegisterWallet(CWalletInterface* pwalletIn) {
135  g_signals.SyncTransaction.connect(boost::bind(&CWalletInterface::SyncTransaction, pwalletIn, _1, _2, _3));
136  g_signals.EraseTransaction.connect(boost::bind(&CWalletInterface::EraseFromWallet, pwalletIn, _1));
137  g_signals.UpdatedTransaction.connect(boost::bind(&CWalletInterface::UpdatedTransaction, pwalletIn, _1));
138  g_signals.SetBestChain.connect(boost::bind(&CWalletInterface::SetBestChain, pwalletIn, _1));
139  g_signals.Inventory.connect(boost::bind(&CWalletInterface::Inventory, pwalletIn, _1));
140  g_signals.Broadcast.connect(boost::bind(&CWalletInterface::ResendWalletTransactions, pwalletIn, _1));
141 }

143 void UnregisterWallet(CWalletInterface* pwalletIn) {
144  g_signals.Broadcast.disconnect(boost::bind(&CWalletInterface::ResendWalletTransactions, pwalletIn, _1));
145  g_signals.Inventory.disconnect(boost::bind(&CWalletInterface::Inventory, pwalletIn, _1));
146  g_signals.SetBestChain.disconnect(boost::bind(&CWalletInterface::SetBestChain, pwalletIn, _1));
147  g_signals.UpdatedTransaction.disconnect(boost::bind(&CWalletInterface::UpdatedTransaction, pwalletIn, _1));
148  g_signals.EraseTransaction.disconnect(boost::bind(&CWalletInterface::EraseFromWallet, pwalletIn, _1));
149  g_signals.SyncTransaction.disconnect(boost::bind(&CWalletInterface::SyncTransaction, pwalletIn, _1, _2, _3));

183 // Maintain validation-specific state about nodes, protected by cs_main, instead
184 // by CNode's own locks. This simplifies asynchronous operation, where
185 // processing of incoming data is done after the ProcessMessage call returns,
186 // and we're no longer holding the node's locks.
187 struct CNodeState {
188  // Accumulated misbehaviour score for this peer.
189  int nMisbehavior;
190  // Whether this peer should be disconnected and banned.
191  bool fShouldBan;
192  std::string name;
193  // List of asynchronously-determined block rejections to notify this peer about.
194  std::vector<CBlockReject> rejects;
195  list<QueuedBlock> vBlocksInFlight;
196  int nBlocksInFlight;
197  list<uint256> vBlocksToDownload;
198  int nBlocksToDownload;
199  int64_t nLastBlockReceive;
200  int64_t nLastBlockProcess;
201 
202  CNodeState() {
203  nMisbehavior = 0;
204  fShouldBan = false;
205  nBlocksToDownload = 0;
206  nBlocksInFlight = 0;
207  nLastBlockReceive = 0;
208  nLastBlockProcess = 0;
209  }
210 };
211 
212 map<NodeId, CNodeState> mapNodeState;
213 
214 // Requires cs_main.
215 CNodeState *State(NodeId pnode) {
216  map<NodeId, CNodeState>::iterator it = mapNodeState.find(pnode);
217  if (it == mapNodeState.end())
218  return NULL;
219  return &it->second;
220 }
221 
222 int GetHeight()
223 {
224  while(true){
225  TRY_LOCK(cs_main, lockMain);
226  if(!lockMain) { MilliSleep(50); continue; }
227  return pindexBest->nHeight;
228  }
229 }

231 void InitializeNode(NodeId nodeid, const CNode *pnode) {
232  LOCK(cs_main);
233  CNodeState &state = mapNodeState.insert(std::make_pair(nodeid, CNodeState())).first->second;
234  state.name = pnode->addrName;
235 }
236 
237 void FinalizeNode(NodeId nodeid) {
238  LOCK(cs_main);
239  CNodeState *state = State(nodeid);
240 
241  BOOST_FOREACH(const QueuedBlock& entry, state->vBlocksInFlight)
242  mapBlocksInFlight.erase(entry.hash);
243  BOOST_FOREACH(const uint256& hash, state->vBlocksToDownload)
244  mapBlocksToDownload.erase(hash);
245 
246  mapNodeState.erase(nodeid);
247 }
248 
249 // Requires cs_main.
250 void MarkBlockAsReceived(const uint256 &hash, NodeId nodeFrom = -1) {
251  map<uint256, pair<NodeId, list<uint256>::iterator> >::iterator itToDownload = mapBlocksToDownload.find(hash);
252  if (itToDownload != mapBlocksToDownload.end()) {
253  CNodeState *state = State(itToDownload->second.first);
254  state->vBlocksToDownload.erase(itToDownload->second.second);
255  state->nBlocksToDownload--;
256  mapBlocksToDownload.erase(itToDownload);
257  }
258 
259  map<uint256, pair<NodeId, list<QueuedBlock>::iterator> >::iterator itInFlight = mapBlocksInFlight.find(hash);
260  if (itInFlight != mapBlocksInFlight.end()) {
261  CNodeState *state = State(itInFlight->second.first);
262  state->vBlocksInFlight.erase(itInFlight->second.second);
263  state->nBlocksInFlight--;
264  if (itInFlight->second.first == nodeFrom)
265  state->nLastBlockReceive = GetTimeMicros();
266  mapBlocksInFlight.erase(itInFlight);
267  }
268 
269 }
270 
271 // Requires cs_main.
272 bool AddBlockToQueue(NodeId nodeid, const uint256 &hash) {
273  if (mapBlocksToDownload.count(hash) || mapBlocksInFlight.count(hash))
274  return false;
275 
276  CNodeState *state = State(nodeid);
277  if (state == NULL)
278  return false;
279 
280  list<uint256>::iterator it = state->vBlocksToDownload.insert(state->vBlocksToDownload.end(), hash);
281  state->nBlocksToDownload++;
282  if (state->nBlocksToDownload > 5000)
283  Misbehaving(nodeid, 10);
284  mapBlocksToDownload[hash] = std::make_pair(nodeid, it);
285  return true;
286 }
287 
288 // Requires cs_main.
289 void MarkBlockAsInFlight(NodeId nodeid, const uint256 &hash) {
290  CNodeState *state = State(nodeid);
291  assert(state != NULL);
292 
293  // Make sure it's not listed somewhere already.
294  MarkBlockAsReceived(hash);
295 
296  QueuedBlock newentry = {hash, GetTimeMicros(), state->nBlocksInFlight};
297  if (state->nBlocksInFlight == 0)
298  state->nLastBlockReceive = newentry.nTime; // Reset when a first request is sent.
299  list<QueuedBlock>::iterator it = state->vBlocksInFlight.insert(state->vBlocksInFlight.end(), newentry);
300  state->nBlocksInFlight++;
301  mapBlocksInFlight[hash] = std::make_pair(nodeid, it);
302 }
303 
304 }

306 bool GetNodeStateStats(NodeId nodeid, CNodeStateStats &stats) {
307  LOCK(cs_main);
308  CNodeState *state = State(nodeid);
309  if (state == NULL)
310  return false;
311  stats.nMisbehavior = state->nMisbehavior;
312  return true;
313 }

334 bool AbortNode(const std::string &strMessage, const std::string &userMessage) {
335  strMiscWarning = strMessage;
336  LogPrintf("*** %s\n", strMessage);
337  uiInterface.ThreadSafeMessageBox(
338  userMessage.empty() ? _("Error: A fatal internal error occured, see debug.log for details") : userMessage,
339  "", CClientUIInterface::MSG_ERROR);
340  StartShutdown();
341  return false;
342 }

345 //

348 
349 bool AddOrphanTx(const CTransaction& tx)
350 {
351  uint256 hash = tx.GetHash();
352  if (mapOrphanTransactions.count(hash))
353  return false;
354 
355  // Ignore big transactions, to avoid a
356  // send-big-orphans memory exhaustion attack. If a peer has a legitimate
357  // large transaction with a missing parent then we assume
358  // it will rebroadcast it later, after the parent transaction(s)
359  // have been mined or received.
360  // 10,000 orphans, each of which is at most 5,000 bytes big is
361  // at most 500 megabytes of orphans:
362 
363  size_t nSize = tx.GetSerializeSize(SER_NETWORK, CTransaction::CURRENT_VERSION);
364 
365  if (nSize > 5000)
366  {
367  LogPrint("mempool", "ignoring large orphan tx (size: %u, hash: %s)\n", nSize, hash.ToString());
368  return false;
369  }
370 
371  mapOrphanTransactions[hash] = tx;
372  BOOST_FOREACH(const CTxIn& txin, tx.vin)
373  mapOrphanTransactionsByPrev[txin.prevout.hash].insert(hash);
374 
375  LogPrint("mempool", "stored orphan tx %s (mapsz %u)\n", hash.ToString(),
376  mapOrphanTransactions.size());
377  return true;
378 }
379 
380 void static EraseOrphanTx(uint256 hash)
381 {
382  map<uint256, CTransaction>::iterator it = mapOrphanTransactions.find(hash);
383  if (it == mapOrphanTransactions.end())
384  return;
385  BOOST_FOREACH(const CTxIn& txin, it->second.vin)
386  {
387  map<uint256, set<uint256> >::iterator itPrev = mapOrphanTransactionsByPrev.find(txin.prevout.hash);
388  if (itPrev == mapOrphanTransactionsByPrev.end())
389  continue;
390  itPrev->second.erase(hash);
391  if (itPrev->second.empty())
392  mapOrphanTransactionsByPrev.erase(itPrev);
393  }
394  mapOrphanTransactions.erase(it);
395 }
396 
397 
398 unsigned int LimitOrphanTxSize(unsigned int nMaxOrphans)
399 {
400  unsigned int nEvicted = 0;
401  while (mapOrphanTransactions.size() > nMaxOrphans)
402  {
403  // Evict a random orphan:
404  uint256 randomhash = GetRandHash();
405  map<uint256, CTransaction>::iterator it = mapOrphanTransactions.lower_bound(randomhash);
406  if (it == mapOrphanTransactions.end())
407  it = mapOrphanTransactions.begin();
408  EraseOrphanTx(it->first);
409  ++nEvicted;
410  }
411  return nEvicted;
412 }

454 bool IsStandardTx(const CTransaction& tx, string& reason)
455 {
456  if (tx.nVersion > CTransaction::CURRENT_VERSION || tx.nVersion < 1) {
457  reason = "version";
458  return false;
459  }
460 
461  // Treat non-final transactions as non-standard to prevent a specific type
462  // of double-spend attack, as well as DoS attacks. (if the transaction
463  // can't be mined, the attacker isn't expending resources broadcasting it)
464  // Basically we don't want to propagate transactions that can't be included in
465  // the next block.
466  //
467  // However, IsFinalTx() is confusing... Without arguments, it uses
468  // chainActive.Height() to evaluate nLockTime; when a block is accepted, chainActive.Height()
469  // is set to the value of nHeight in the block. However, when IsFinalTx()
470  // is called within CBlock::AcceptBlock(), the height of the block *being*
471  // evaluated is what is used. Thus if we want to know if a transaction can
472  // be part of the *next* block, we need to call IsFinalTx() with one more
473  // than chainActive.Height().
474  //
475  // Timestamps on the other hand don't get any special treatment, because we
476  // can't know what timestamp the next block will have, and there aren't
477  // timestamp applications where it matters.
478  if (!IsFinalTx(tx, nBestHeight + 1)) {
479  reason = "non-final";
480  return false;
481  }
482  // nTime has different purpose from nLockTime but can be used in similar attacks
483  if (tx.nTime > FutureDrift(GetAdjustedTime(), nBestHeight)) {
484  reason = "time-too-new";
485  return false;
486  }
487 
488  // Extremely large transactions with lots of inputs can cost the network
489  // almost as much to process as they cost the sender in fees, because
490  // computing signature hashes is O(ninputs*txsize). Limiting transactions
491  // to MAX_STANDARD_TX_SIZE mitigates CPU exhaustion attacks.
492  unsigned int sz = tx.GetSerializeSize(SER_NETWORK, CTransaction::CURRENT_VERSION);
493  if (sz >= MAX_STANDARD_TX_SIZE) {
494  reason = "tx-size";
495  return false;
496  }
497 
498  BOOST_FOREACH(const CTxIn& txin, tx.vin)
499  {
500  // Biggest 'standard' txin is a 15-of-15 P2SH multisig with compressed
501  // keys. (remember the 520 byte limit on redeemScript size) That works
502  // out to a (15*(33+1))+3=513 byte redeemScript, 513+1+15*(73+1)+3=1627
503  // bytes of scriptSig, which we round off to 1650 bytes for some minor
504  // future-proofing. That's also enough to spend a 20-of-20
505  // CHECKMULTISIG scriptPubKey, though such a scriptPubKey is not
506  // considered standard)
507  if (txin.scriptSig.size() > 1650) {
508  reason = "scriptsig-size";
509  return false;
510  }
511  if (!txin.scriptSig.IsPushOnly()) {
512  reason = "scriptsig-not-pushonly";
513  return false;
514  }
515  if (!txin.scriptSig.HasCanonicalPushes()) {
516  reason = "scriptsig-non-canonical-push";
517  return false;
518  }
519  }
520 
521  unsigned int nDataOut = 0;
522 
523  txnouttype whichType;
524  BOOST_FOREACH(const CTxOut& txout, tx.vout) {
525  if (!::IsStandard(txout.scriptPubKey, whichType))
526  {
527  reason = "scriptpubkey";
528  return false;
529  }
530  if (whichType == TX_NULL_DATA)
531  {
532  nDataOut++;
533  } else if (txout.nValue == 0) {
534  reason = "dust";
535  return false;
536  }
537  if (!txout.scriptPubKey.HasCanonicalPushes()) {
538  reason = "scriptpubkey-non-canonical-push";
539  return false;
540  }
541  }
542 
543  // not more than one data txout per non-data txout is permitted
544  // only one data txout is permitted too
545  if (nDataOut > 1 && nDataOut > tx.vout.size()/2) {
546  reason = "multi-op-return";
547  return false;
548  }
549 
550  return true;
551 }
552 
553 bool IsFinalTx(const CTransaction &tx, int nBlockHeight, int64_t nBlockTime)
554 {
555  AssertLockHeld(cs_main);
556  // Time based nLockTime implemented in 0.1.6
557  if (tx.nLockTime == 0)
558  return true;
559  if (nBlockHeight == 0)
560  nBlockHeight = nBestHeight;
561  if (nBlockTime == 0)
562  nBlockTime = GetAdjustedTime();
563  if ((int64_t)tx.nLockTime < ((int64_t)tx.nLockTime < LOCKTIME_THRESHOLD ? (int64_t)nBlockHeight : nBlockTime))
564  return true;
565  BOOST_FOREACH(const CTxIn& txin, tx.vin)
566  if (!txin.IsFinal())
567  return false;
568  return true;
569 }
570 
571 //
572 // Check transaction inputs to mitigate two
573 // potential denial-of-service attacks:
574 //
575 // 1. scriptSigs with extra data stuffed into them,
576 // not consumed by scriptPubKey (or P2SH script)
577 // 2. P2SH scripts with a crazy number of expensive
578 // CHECKSIG/CHECKMULTISIG operations
579 //
580 bool AreInputsStandard(const CTransaction& tx, const MapPrevTx& mapInputs)
581 {
582  if (tx.IsCoinBase())
583  return true; // Coinbases don't use vin normally
584 
585  for (unsigned int i = 0; i < tx.vin.size(); i++)
586  {
587  const CTxOut& prev = tx.GetOutputFor(tx.vin[i], mapInputs);
588 
589  vector<vector<unsigned char> > vSolutions;
590  txnouttype whichType;
591  // get the scriptPubKey corresponding to this input:
592  const CScript& prevScript = prev.scriptPubKey;
593  if (!Solver(prevScript, whichType, vSolutions))
594  return false;
595  int nArgsExpected = ScriptSigArgsExpected(whichType, vSolutions);
596  if (nArgsExpected < 0)
597  return false;
598 
599  // Transactions with extra stuff in their scriptSigs are
600  // non-standard. Note that this EvalScript() call will
601  // be quick, because if there are any operations
602  // beside "push data" in the scriptSig
603  // IsStandard() will have already returned false
604  // and this method isn't called.
605  vector<vector<unsigned char> > stack;
606  if (!EvalScript(stack, tx.vin[i].scriptSig, tx, i, SCRIPT_VERIFY_NONE, 0))
607  return false;
608 
609  if (whichType == TX_SCRIPTHASH)
610  {
611  if (stack.empty())
612  return false;
613  CScript subscript(stack.back().begin(), stack.back().end());
614  vector<vector<unsigned char> > vSolutions2;
615  txnouttype whichType2;
616  if (Solver(subscript, whichType2, vSolutions2))
617  {
618  int tmpExpected = ScriptSigArgsExpected(whichType2, vSolutions2);
619 
620  if (whichType2 == TX_SCRIPTHASH)
621  return false;
622  if (tmpExpected < 0)
623  return false;
624 
625  nArgsExpected += tmpExpected;
626  }
627  else
628  {
629  // Any other Script with less than 15 sigops OK:
630  unsigned int sigops = subscript.GetSigOpCount(true);
631  // ... extra data left on the stack after execution is OK, too:
632  return (sigops <= MAX_P2SH_SIGOPS);
633  }
634  }
635 
636  if (stack.size() != (unsigned int)nArgsExpected)
637  return false;
638  }
639 
640  return true;
641 }
642 
643 unsigned int GetLegacySigOpCount(const CTransaction& tx)
644 {
645  unsigned int nSigOps = 0;
646  BOOST_FOREACH(const CTxIn& txin, tx.vin)
647  {
648  nSigOps += txin.scriptSig.GetSigOpCount(false);
649  }
650  BOOST_FOREACH(const CTxOut& txout, tx.vout)
651  {
652  nSigOps += txout.scriptPubKey.GetSigOpCount(false);
653  }
654  return nSigOps;
655 }
656 
657 unsigned int GetP2SHSigOpCount(const CTransaction& tx, const MapPrevTx& inputs)
658 {
659  if (tx.IsCoinBase())
660  return 0;
661 
662  unsigned int nSigOps = 0;
663  for (unsigned int i = 0; i < tx.vin.size(); i++)
664  {
665  const CTxOut& prevout = tx.GetOutputFor(tx.vin[i], inputs);
666  if (prevout.scriptPubKey.IsPayToScriptHash())
667  nSigOps += prevout.scriptPubKey.GetSigOpCount(tx.vin[i].scriptSig);
668  }
669  return nSigOps;
670 }
671 
672 int CMerkleTx::SetMerkleBranch(const CBlock* pblock)
673 {
674  AssertLockHeld(cs_main);
675  CBlock blockTmp;
676 
677  if (pblock == NULL) {
678  // Load the block this tx is in
679  CTxIndex txindex;
680  if (!CTxDB("r").ReadTxIndex(GetHash(), txindex))
681  return 0;
682  if (!blockTmp.ReadFromDisk(txindex.pos.nFile, txindex.pos.nBlockPos)) {
683  return 0;
684  pblock = &blockTmp;
685  }
686  }
687 
688  if (pblock) {
689  // Update the tx's hashBlock
690  hashBlock = pblock->GetHash();
691 
692  // Locate the transaction
693  for (nIndex = 0; nIndex < (int)pblock->vtx.size(); nIndex++)
694  if (pblock->vtx[nIndex] == *(CTransaction*)this)
695  break;
696  if (nIndex == (int)pblock->vtx.size())
697  {
698  vMerkleBranch.clear();
699  nIndex = -1;
700  LogPrintf("ERROR: SetMerkleBranch() : couldn't find tx in block\n");
701  return 0;
702  }
703 
704  // Fill in merkle branch
705  vMerkleBranch = pblock->GetMerkleBranch(nIndex);
706  }
707 
708  // Is the tx in a block that's in the main chain
709  map<uint256, CBlockIndex*>::iterator mi = mapBlockIndex.find(hashBlock);
710  if (mi == mapBlockIndex.end())
711  return 0;
712  CBlockIndex* pindex = (*mi).second;
713  if (!pindex || !pindex->IsInMainChain())
714  return 0;
715 
716  return pindexBest->nHeight - pindex->nHeight + 1;
717 }
718 
719 double CTransaction::ComputePriority(double dPriorityInputs, unsigned int nTxSize) const
720 {
721  // In order to avoid disincentivizing cleaning up the UTXO set we don't count
722  // the constant overhead for each txin and up to 110 bytes of scriptSig (which
723  // is enough to cover a compressed pubkey p2sh redemption) for priority.
724  // Providing any more cleanup incentive than making additional inputs free would
725  // risk encouraging people to create junk outputs to redeem later.
726  if (nTxSize == 0)
727  nTxSize = ::GetSerializeSize(*this, SER_NETWORK, PROTOCOL_VERSION);
728  BOOST_FOREACH(const CTxIn& txin, vin)
729  {
730  unsigned int offset = 41U + std::min(110U, (unsigned int)txin.scriptSig.size());
731  if (nTxSize > offset)
732  nTxSize -= offset;
733  }
734  if (nTxSize == 0) return 0.0;
735  return dPriorityInputs / nTxSize;
736 }
737 
738 bool CTransaction::CheckTransaction() const
739 {
740  // Basic checks that don't depend on any context
741  if (vin.empty())
742  return DoS(10, error("CTransaction::CheckTransaction() : vin empty"));
743  if (vout.empty())
744  return DoS(10, error("CTransaction::CheckTransaction() : vout empty"));
745  // Size limits
746  if (::GetSerializeSize(*this, SER_NETWORK, PROTOCOL_VERSION) > MAX_BLOCK_SIZE)
747  return DoS(100, error("CTransaction::CheckTransaction() : size limits failed"));
748 
749  // Check for negative or overflow output values
750  CAmount nValueOut = 0;
751  for (unsigned int i = 0; i < vout.size(); i++)
752  {
753  const CTxOut& txout = vout[i];
754  if (txout.IsEmpty() && !IsCoinBase() && !IsCoinStake())
755  return DoS(100, error("CTransaction::CheckTransaction() : txout empty for user transaction"));
756  if (txout.nValue < 0)
757  return DoS(100, error("CTransaction::CheckTransaction() : txout.nValue negative"));
758  if (txout.nValue > MAX_MONEY)
759  return DoS(100, error("CTransaction::CheckTransaction() : txout.nValue too high"));
760  nValueOut += txout.nValue;
761  if (!MoneyRange(nValueOut))
762  return DoS(100, error("CTransaction::CheckTransaction() : txout total out of range"));
763  }
764 
765  // Check for duplicate inputs
766  set<COutPoint> vInOutPoints;
767  BOOST_FOREACH(const CTxIn& txin, vin)
768  {
769  if (vInOutPoints.count(txin.prevout))
770  return false;
771  vInOutPoints.insert(txin.prevout);
772  }
773 
774  if (IsCoinBase())
775  {
776  if (vin[0].scriptSig.size() < 2 || vin[0].scriptSig.size() > 100)
777  return DoS(100, error("CTransaction::CheckTransaction() : coinbase script size is invalid"));
778  }
779  else
780  {
781  BOOST_FOREACH(const CTxIn& txin, vin)
782  if (txin.prevout.IsNull())
783  return DoS(10, error("CTransaction::CheckTransaction() : prevout is null"));
784  }
785 
786  return true;
787 }
788 
789 int64_t GetMinFee(const CTransaction& tx, unsigned int nBytes, bool fAllowFree, enum GetMinFee_mode mode)
790 {
791  // Base fee is either MIN_TX_FEE or MIN_RELAY_TX_FEE
792  int64_t nBaseFee = (mode == GMF_RELAY) ? MIN_RELAY_TX_FEE : MIN_TX_FEE;
793 
794  int64_t nMinFee = (1 + (int64_t)nBytes / 1000) * nBaseFee;
795 
796  if (fAllowFree)
797  {
798  // There is a free transaction area in blocks created by most miners,
799  // * If we are relaying we allow transactions up to DEFAULT_BLOCK_PRIORITY_SIZE - 1000
800  // to be considered to fall into this category. We don't want to encourage sending
801  // multiple transactions instead of one big transaction to avoid fees.
802  // * If we are creating a transaction we allow transactions up to 1,000 bytes
803  // to be considered safe and assume they can likely make it into this section.
804  if (nBytes < (mode == GMF_SEND ? 1000 : (DEFAULT_BLOCK_PRIORITY_SIZE - 1000)))
805  nMinFee = 0;
806  }
807 
808  // This code can be removed after enough miners have upgraded to version 0.9.
809  // Until then, be safe when sending and require a fee if any output
810  // is less than CENT:
811  if (nMinFee < nBaseFee && mode == GMF_SEND)
812  {
813  BOOST_FOREACH(const CTxOut& txout, tx.vout)
814  if (txout.nValue < CENT)
815  nMinFee = nBaseFee;
816  }
817 
818  if (!MoneyRange(nMinFee))
819  nMinFee = MAX_MONEY;
820  return nMinFee;
821 }
822 
823 
824 bool AcceptToMemoryPool(CTxMemPool& pool, CTransaction &tx, bool fLimitFree,
825  bool* pfMissingInputs, bool fRejectInsaneFee, bool ignoreFees)
826 {
827  AssertLockHeld(cs_main);
828  if (pfMissingInputs)
829  *pfMissingInputs = false;
830 
831  if (!tx.CheckTransaction())
832  return error("AcceptToMemoryPool : CheckTransaction failed");
833 
834  // Coinbase is only valid in a block, not as a loose transaction
835  if (tx.IsCoinBase())
836  return tx.DoS(100, error("AcceptToMemoryPool : coinbase as individual tx"));
837 
838  // ion: coinstake is also only valid in a block, not as a loose transaction
839  if (tx.IsCoinStake())
840  return tx.DoS(100, error("AcceptToMemoryPool : coinstake as individual tx"));
841 
842  // Rather not work on nonstandard transactions (unless -testnet)
843  string reason;
844  if (!TestNet() && !IsStandardTx(tx, reason))
845  return error("AcceptToMemoryPool : nonstandard transaction: %s",
846  reason);
847 
848  // is it already in the memory pool?
849  uint256 hash = tx.GetHash();
850  if (pool.exists(hash))
851  return false;
852 
853  // ----------- instantX transaction scanning -----------
854 
855  BOOST_FOREACH(const CTxIn& in, tx.vin){
856  if(mapLockedInputs.count(in.prevout)){
857  if(mapLockedInputs[in.prevout] != tx.GetHash()){
858  return tx.DoS(0, error("AcceptToMemoryPool : conflicts with existing transaction lock: %s", reason));
859  }
860  }
861  }
862 
863  // Check for conflicts with in-memory transactions
864  {
865  LOCK(pool.cs); // protect pool.mapNextTx
866  for (unsigned int i = 0; i < tx.vin.size(); i++)
867  {
868  COutPoint outpoint = tx.vin[i].prevout;
869  if (pool.mapNextTx.count(outpoint))
870  {
871  // Disable replacement feature for now
872  return false;
873  }
874  }
875  }
876 
877  {
878  CTxDB txdb("r");
879 
880 
881  // do we already have it?
882  if (txdb.ContainsTx(hash))
883  return false;
884 
885  // do all inputs exist?
886  // Note that this does not check for the presence of actual outputs (see the next check for that),
887  // only helps filling in pfMissingInputs (to determine missing vs spent).
888  BOOST_FOREACH(const CTxIn txin, tx.vin) {
889  if (!txdb.ContainsTx(txin.prevout.hash)) {
890  if (pfMissingInputs)
891  *pfMissingInputs = true;
892  return false;
893  }
894  }
895  MapPrevTx mapInputs;
896  map<uint256, CTxIndex> mapUnused;
897  bool fInvalid = false;
898  if (!tx.FetchInputs(txdb, mapUnused, false, false, mapInputs, fInvalid))
899  {
900  if (fInvalid)
901  return error("AcceptToMemoryPool : FetchInputs found invalid tx %s", hash.ToString());
902  return false;
903  }
904 
905  // Check for non-standard pay-to-script-hash in inputs
906  if (!TestNet() && !AreInputsStandard(tx, mapInputs))
907  return error("AcceptToMemoryPool : nonstandard transaction input");
908 
909  // Check that the transaction doesn't have an excessive number of
910  // sigops, making it impossible to mine. Since the coinbase transaction
911  // itself can contain sigops MAX_TX_SIGOPS is less than
912  // MAX_BLOCK_SIGOPS; we still consider this an invalid rather than
913  // merely non-standard transaction.
914  unsigned int nSigOps = GetLegacySigOpCount(tx);
915  nSigOps += GetP2SHSigOpCount(tx, mapInputs);
916  if (nSigOps > MAX_TX_SIGOPS)
917  return tx.DoS(0,
918  error("AcceptToMemoryPool : too many sigops %s, %d > %d",
919  hash.ToString(), nSigOps, MAX_TX_SIGOPS));
920 
921  CAmount nFees = tx.GetValueIn(mapInputs)-tx.GetValueOut();
922  unsigned int nSize = ::GetSerializeSize(tx, SER_NETWORK, PROTOCOL_VERSION);
923 
924  // Don't accept it if it can't get into a block
925  // but prioritise dstx and don't check fees for it
926  if(mapStashedsendBroadcastTxes.count(hash)) {
927  // Normally we would PrioritiseTransaction But currently it is unimplemented
928  // mempool.PrioritiseTransaction(hash, hash.ToString(), 1000, 0.1*COIN);
929  } else if(!ignoreFees){
930  int64_t txMinFee = GetMinFee(tx, nSize, true, GMF_RELAY);
931  if (fLimitFree && nFees < txMinFee)
932  return error("AcceptToMemoryPool : not enough fees %s, %d < %d",
933  hash.ToString(),
934  nFees, txMinFee);
935 
936  // Continuously rate-limit free transactions
937  // This mitigates 'penny-flooding' -- sending thousands of free transactions just to
938  // be annoying or make others' transactions take longer to confirm.
939  if (fLimitFree && nFees < MIN_RELAY_TX_FEE)
940  {
941  static CCriticalSection csFreeLimiter;
942  static double dFreeCount;
943  static int64_t nLastTime;
944  int64_t nNow = GetTime();
945 
946  LOCK(csFreeLimiter);
947 
948  // Use an exponentially decaying ~10-minute window:
949  dFreeCount *= pow(1.0 - 1.0/600.0, (double)(nNow - nLastTime));
950  nLastTime = nNow;
951  // -limitfreerelay unit is thousand-bytes-per-minute
952  // At default rate it would take over a month to fill 1GB
953  if (dFreeCount > GetArg("-limitfreerelay", 15)*10*1000)
954  return error("AcceptableInputs : free transaction rejected by rate limiter");
955  LogPrint("mempool", "Rate limit dFreeCount: %g => %g\n", dFreeCount, dFreeCount+nSize);
956  dFreeCount += nSize;
957  }
958  }
959 
960  if (fRejectInsaneFee && nFees > MIN_RELAY_TX_FEE * 10000)
961  return error("AcceptableInputs: : insane fees %s, %d > %d",
962  hash.ToString(),
963  nFees, MIN_RELAY_TX_FEE * 10000);
964 
965  // Check against previous transactions
966  // This is done last to help prevent CPU exhaustion denial-of-service attacks.
967  if (!tx.ConnectInputs(txdb, mapInputs, mapUnused, CDiskTxPos(1,1,1), pindexBest, false, false, STANDARD_SCRIPT_VERIFY_FLAGS))
968  {
969  return error("AcceptToMemoryPool : ConnectInputs failed %s", hash.ToString());
970  }
971 
972  // Check again against just the consensus-critical mandatory script
973  // verification flags, in case of bugs in the standard flags that cause
974  // transactions to pass as valid when they're actually invalid. For
975  // instance the STRICTENC flag was incorrectly allowing certain
976  // CHECKSIG NOT scripts to pass, even though they were invalid.
977  //
978  // There is a similar check in CreateNewBlock() to prevent creating
979  // invalid blocks, however allowing such transactions into the mempool
980  // can be exploited as a DoS attack.
981  if (!tx.ConnectInputs(txdb, mapInputs, mapUnused, CDiskTxPos(1,1,1), pindexBest, false, false, MANDATORY_SCRIPT_VERIFY_FLAGS))
982  {
983  return error("AcceptToMemoryPool: : BUG! PLEASE REPORT THIS! ConnectInputs failed against MANDATORY but not STANDARD flags %s", hash.ToString());
984  }
985  }
986 
987  // Store transaction in memory
988  pool.addUnchecked(hash, tx);
989  setValidatedTx.insert(hash);
990 
991  SyncWithWallets(tx, NULL);
992 
993  LogPrint("mempool", "AcceptToMemoryPool : accepted %s (poolsz %u)\n",
994  hash.ToString(),
995  pool.mapTx.size());
996 
997  return true;
998 }
999 
1000 bool AcceptableInputs(CTxMemPool& pool, const CTransaction &txo, bool fLimitFree,
1001  bool* pfMissingInputs, bool fRejectInsaneFee, bool isDSTX)
1002 {
1003  AssertLockHeld(cs_main);
1004  if (pfMissingInputs)
1005  *pfMissingInputs = false;
1006 
1007  CTransaction tx(txo);
1008  string reason;
1009 
1010  if (!tx.CheckTransaction())
1011  return error("AcceptableInputs : CheckTransaction failed");
1012 
1013  // Coinbase is only valid in a block, not as a loose transaction
1014  if (tx.IsCoinBase())
1015  return tx.DoS(100, error("AcceptableInputs : coinbase as individual tx"));
1016 
1017  // ion: coinstake is also only valid in a block, not as a loose transaction
1018  if (tx.IsCoinStake())
1019  return tx.DoS(100, error("AcceptableInputs : coinstake as individual tx"));
1020 
1021  // is it already in the memory pool?
1022  uint256 hash = tx.GetHash();
1023  if (pool.exists(hash))
1024  return false;
1025 
1026  // ----------- instantX transaction scanning -----------
1027 
1028  BOOST_FOREACH(const CTxIn& in, tx.vin){
1029  if(mapLockedInputs.count(in.prevout)){
1030  if(mapLockedInputs[in.prevout] != tx.GetHash()){
1031  return tx.DoS(0, error("AcceptableInputs : conflicts with existing transaction lock: %s", reason));
1032  }
1033  }
1034  }
1035 
1036  // Check for conflicts with in-memory transactions
1037  {
1038  LOCK(pool.cs); // protect pool.mapNextTx
1039  for (unsigned int i = 0; i < tx.vin.size(); i++)
1040  {
1041  COutPoint outpoint = tx.vin[i].prevout;
1042  if (pool.mapNextTx.count(outpoint))
1043  {
1044  // Disable replacement feature for now
1045  return false;
1046  }
1047  }
1048  }
1049 
1050  {
1051  CTxDB txdb("r");
1052 
1053  // do we already have it?
1054  if (txdb.ContainsTx(hash))
1055  return false;
1056 
1057  MapPrevTx mapInputs;
1058  map<uint256, CTxIndex> mapUnused;
1059  bool fInvalid = false;
1060  if (!tx.FetchInputs(txdb, mapUnused, false, false, mapInputs, fInvalid))
1061  {
1062  if (fInvalid)
1063  return error("AcceptableInputs : FetchInputs found invalid tx %s", hash.ToString());
1064  return false;
1065  }
1066 
1067  // Check for non-standard pay-to-script-hash in inputs
1068  //if (!TestNet() && !AreInputsStandard(tx, mapInputs))
1069  // return error("AcceptToMemoryPool : nonstandard transaction input");
1070 
1071  // Check that the transaction doesn't have an excessive number of
1072  // sigops, making it impossible to mine. Since the coinbase transaction
1073  // itself can contain sigops MAX_TX_SIGOPS is less than
1074  // MAX_BLOCK_SIGOPS; we still consider this an invalid rather than
1075  // merely non-standard transaction.
1076  unsigned int nSigOps = GetLegacySigOpCount(tx);
1077  nSigOps += GetP2SHSigOpCount(tx, mapInputs);
1078  if (nSigOps > MAX_TX_SIGOPS)
1079  return tx.DoS(0,
1080  error("AcceptableInputs : too many sigops %s, %d > %d",
1081  hash.ToString(), nSigOps, MAX_TX_SIGOPS));
1082 
1083  CAmount nFees = tx.GetValueIn(mapInputs)-tx.GetValueOut();
1084  unsigned int nSize = ::GetSerializeSize(tx, SER_NETWORK, PROTOCOL_VERSION);
1085  int64_t txMinFee = GetMinFee(tx, nSize, true, GMF_RELAY);
1086 
1087 
1088  // Don't accept it if it can't get into a block
1089  if(isDSTX) {
1090  // Normally we would PrioritiseTransaction But currently it is unimplemented
1091  // mempool.PrioritiseTransaction(hash, hash.ToString(), 1000, 0.1*COIN);
1092  } else { // same as !ignoreFees for AcceptToMemoryPool
1093  if (fLimitFree && nFees < txMinFee)
1094  return error("AcceptableInputs : not enough fees %s, %d < %d",
1095  hash.ToString(),
1096  nFees, txMinFee);
1097 
1098  // Continuously rate-limit free transactions
1099  // This mitigates 'penny-flooding' -- sending thousands of free transactions just to
1100  // be annoying or make others' transactions take longer to confirm.
1101  if (fLimitFree && nFees < MIN_RELAY_TX_FEE)
1102  {
1103  static CCriticalSection csFreeLimiter;
1104  static double dFreeCount;
1105  static int64_t nLastTime;
1106  int64_t nNow = GetTime();
1107 
1108  LOCK(csFreeLimiter);
1109 
1110  // Use an exponentially decaying ~10-minute window:
1111  dFreeCount *= pow(1.0 - 1.0/600.0, (double)(nNow - nLastTime));
1112  nLastTime = nNow;
1113  // -limitfreerelay unit is thousand-bytes-per-minute
1114  // At default rate it would take over a month to fill 1GB
1115  if (dFreeCount > GetArg("-limitfreerelay", 15)*10*1000)
1116  return error("AcceptableInputs : free transaction rejected by rate limiter");
1117  LogPrint("mempool", "Rate limit dFreeCount: %g => %g\n", dFreeCount, dFreeCount+nSize);
1118  dFreeCount += nSize;
1119  }
1120  }
1121 
1122  if (fRejectInsaneFee && nFees > txMinFee * 10000)
1123  return error("AcceptableInputs: : insane fees %s, %d > %d",
1124  hash.ToString(),
1125  nFees, MIN_RELAY_TX_FEE * 10000);
1126 
1127  // Check against previous transactions
1128  // This is done last to help prevent CPU exhaustion denial-of-service attacks.
1129  if (!tx.ConnectInputs(txdb, mapInputs, mapUnused, CDiskTxPos(1,1,1), pindexBest, true, false, STANDARD_SCRIPT_VERIFY_FLAGS, false))
1130  {
1131  return error("AcceptableInputs : ConnectInputs failed %s", hash.ToString());
1132  }
1133  }
1134 
1135 
1136  /*LogPrint("mempool", "AcceptableInputs : accepted %s (poolsz %u)\n",
1137  hash.ToString(),
1138  pool.mapTx.size());
1139  */
1140  return true;
1141 }

1144 int CMerkleTx::GetDepthInMainChainINTERNAL(CBlockIndex* &pindexRet) const
1145 {
1146  if (hashBlock == 0 || nIndex == -1)
1147  return 0;
1148  AssertLockHeld(cs_main);
1149 
1150  // Find the block it claims to be in
1151  map<uint256, CBlockIndex*>::iterator mi = mapBlockIndex.find(hashBlock);
1152  if (mi == mapBlockIndex.end())
1153  return 0;
1154  CBlockIndex* pindex = (*mi).second;
1155  if (!pindex || !pindex->IsInMainChain())
1156  return 0;
1157 
1158  // Make sure the merkle branch connects to this block
1159  if (!fMerkleVerified)
1160  {
1161  if (CBlock::CheckMerkleBranch(GetHash(), vMerkleBranch, nIndex) != pindex->hashMerkleRoot)
1162  return 0;
1163  fMerkleVerified = true;
1164  }
1165 
1166  pindexRet = pindex;
1167  return pindexBest->nHeight - pindex->nHeight + 1;
1168 }

1170 int CMerkleTx::GetTransactionLockSignatures() const
1171 {
1172  if(!IsSporkActive(SPORK_2_INSTANTX)) return -3;
1173  if(!fEnableInstantX) return -1;
1174 
1175  //compile consessus vote
1176  std::map<uint256, CTransactionLock>::iterator i = mapTxLocks.find(GetHash());
1177  if (i != mapTxLocks.end()){
1178  return (*i).second.CountSignatures();
1179  }
1180 
1181  return -1;
1182 }
1183 
1184 bool CMerkleTx::IsTransactionLockTimedOut() const
1185 {
1186  if(!fEnableInstantX) return -1;
1187 
1188  //compile consessus vote
1189  std::map<uint256, CTransactionLock>::iterator i = mapTxLocks.find(GetHash());
1190  if (i != mapTxLocks.end()){
1191  return GetTime() > (*i).second.nTimeout;
1192  }
1193 
1194  return false;
1195 }

1197 int CMerkleTx::GetDepthInMainChain(CBlockIndex* &pindexRet, bool enableIX) const
1198 {
1199  AssertLockHeld(cs_main);
1200  int nResult = GetDepthInMainChainINTERNAL(pindexRet);
1201  if (nResult == 0 && !mempool.exists(GetHash()))
1202  return -1; // Not in chain, not in mempool
1203 
1204  if(enableIX){
1205  if (nResult < 10){
1206  int signatures = GetTransactionLockSignatures();
1207  if(signatures >= INSTANTX_SIGNATURES_REQUIRED){
1208  return nInstantXDepth+nResult;
1209  }
1210  }
1211  }
1212 
1213  return nResult;
1214 }

1216 int CMerkleTx::GetBlocksToMaturity() const
1217 {
1218  if (!(IsCoinBase() || IsCoinStake()))
1219  return 0;
1220  return max(0, DetermineCoinbaseMaturity() - GetDepthInMainChain());
1221 }

1231 bool CWalletTx::AcceptWalletTransaction(CTxDB& txdb)
1232 {
1233 
1234  {
1235  // Add previous supporting transactions first
1236  BOOST_FOREACH(CMerkleTx& tx, vtxPrev)
1237  {
1238  if (!(tx.IsCoinBase() || tx.IsCoinStake()))
1239  {
1240  uint256 hash = tx.GetHash();
1241  if (!mempool.exists(hash) && !txdb.ContainsTx(hash))
1242  tx.AcceptToMemoryPool(false);
1243  }
1244  }
1245  return AcceptToMemoryPool(false);
1246  }
1247  return false;
1248 }

1265  {

1267  }
1268  else
1269  return 0;
1270  }
1271  else
1272  return 0;
1273 }

1310 int CTxIndex::GetDepthInMainChain() const
1311 {
1312  // Read block header
1313  CBlock block;
1314  if (!block.ReadFromDisk(pos.nFile, pos.nBlockPos, false))
1315  return 0;
1316  // Find the block in the index
1317  map<uint256, CBlockIndex*>::iterator mi = mapBlockIndex.find(block.GetHash());
1318  if (mi == mapBlockIndex.end())
1319  return 0;
1320  CBlockIndex* pindex = (*mi).second;
1321  if (!pindex || !pindex->IsInMainChain())
1322  return 0;
1323  return 1 + nBestHeight - pindex->nHeight;
1324 }
1325 
1326 // Return transaction in tx, and if it was found inside a block, its hash is placed in hashBlock
1327 bool GetTransaction(const uint256 &hash, CTransaction &tx, uint256 &hashBlock)
1328 {
1329  {
1330  LOCK(cs_main);
1331  {
1332  if (mempool.lookup(hash, tx))
1333  {
1334  return true;
1335  }
1336  }
1337  CTxDB txdb("r");
1338  CTxIndex txindex;
1339  if (tx.ReadFromDisk(txdb, hash, txindex))
1340  {
1341  CBlock block;
1342  if (block.ReadFromDisk(txindex.pos.nFile, txindex.pos.nBlockPos, false))
1343  hashBlock = block.GetHash();
1344  return true;
1345  }
1346  // look for transaction in disconnected blocks to find orphaned CoinBase and CoinStake transactions
1347  BOOST_FOREACH(PAIRTYPE(const uint256, CBlockIndex*)& item, mapBlockIndex)
1348  {
1349  CBlockIndex* pindex = item.second;
1350  if (pindex == pindexBest || pindex->pnext != 0)
1351  continue;
1352  CBlock block;
1353  if (!block.ReadFromDisk(pindex))
1354  continue;
1355  BOOST_FOREACH(const CTransaction& txOrphan, block.vtx)
1356  {
1357  if (txOrphan.GetHash() == hash)
1358  {
1359  tx = txOrphan;
1360  return true;
1361  }
1362  }
1363  }
1364  }
1365  return false;
1366 }

1370 // CBlock and CBlockIndex
1371 //
1372 
1373 static CBlockIndex* pblockindexFBBHLast;
1374 CBlockIndex* FindBlockByHeight(int nHeight)
1375 {
1376  CBlockIndex *pblockindex;
1377  if (nHeight < nBestHeight / 2)
1378  pblockindex = pindexGenesisBlock;
1379  else
1380  pblockindex = pindexBest;
1381  if (pblockindexFBBHLast && abs(nHeight - pblockindex->nHeight) > abs(nHeight - pblockindexFBBHLast->nHeight))
1382  pblockindex = pblockindexFBBHLast;
1383  while (pblockindex->nHeight > nHeight)
1384  pblockindex = pblockindex->pprev;
1385  while (pblockindex->nHeight < nHeight)
1386  pblockindex = pblockindex->pnext;
1387  pblockindexFBBHLast = pblockindex;
1388  return pblockindex;
1389 }

1391 bool CBlock::ReadFromDisk(const CBlockIndex* pindex, bool fReadTransactions)
1392 {

1394  {
1395  *this = pindex->GetBlockHeader();
1396  return true;
1397  }
1398  if (!ReadFromDisk(pindex->nFile, pindex->nBlockPos, fReadTransactions))
1399  return false;
1400  if (GetHash() != pindex->GetBlockHash())
1401  return error("CBlock::ReadFromDisk() : GetHash() doesn't match index");
1402  return true;
1403 }

1405 uint256 static GetOrphanRoot(const uint256& hash)
1406 {
1407  map<uint256, COrphanBlock*>::iterator it = mapOrphanBlocks.find(hash);
1408  if (it == mapOrphanBlocks.end())
1409  return hash;
1410 
1411  // Work back to the first block in the orphan chain
1412  do {
1413  map<uint256, COrphanBlock*>::iterator it2 = mapOrphanBlocks.find(it->second->hashPrev);
1414  if (it2 == mapOrphanBlocks.end())
1415  return it->first;
1416  it = it2;
1417  } while(true);
1418 }
1419 
1420 // ion: find block wanted by given orphan block
1421 uint256 WantedByOrphan(const COrphanBlock* pblockOrphan)
1422 {
1423  // Work back to the first block in the orphan chain
1424  while (mapOrphanBlocks.count(pblockOrphan->hashPrev))
1425  pblockOrphan = mapOrphanBlocks[pblockOrphan->hashPrev];
1426  return pblockOrphan->hashPrev;
1427 }
1428 
1429 // Remove a random orphan block (which does not have any dependent orphans).
1430 void static PruneOrphanBlocks()
1431 {
1432  if (mapOrphanBlocksByPrev.size() <= (size_t)std::max((int64_t)0, GetArg("-maxorphanblocks", DEFAULT_MAX_ORPHAN_BLOCKS)))
1433  return;
1434 
1435  // Pick a random orphan block.
1436  int pos = insecure_rand() % mapOrphanBlocksByPrev.size();
1437  std::multimap<uint256, COrphanBlock*>::iterator it = mapOrphanBlocksByPrev.begin();
1438  while (pos--) it++;
1439 
1440  // As long as this block has other orphans depending on it, move to one of those successors.
1441  do {
1442  std::multimap<uint256, COrphanBlock*>::iterator it2 = mapOrphanBlocksByPrev.find(it->second->hashBlock);
1443  if (it2 == mapOrphanBlocksByPrev.end())
1444  break;
1445  it = it2;
1446  } while(1);
1447 
1448  setStakeSeenOrphan.erase(it->second->stake);
1449  uint256 hash = it->second->hashBlock;
1450  delete it->second;
1451  mapOrphanBlocksByPrev.erase(it);
1452  mapOrphanBlocks.erase(hash);
1453 }
1454 
1455 // ion: find last block index up to pindex
1456 const CBlockIndex* GetLastBlockIndex(const CBlockIndex* pindex, bool fProofOfStake)
1457 {
1458  while (pindex && pindex->pprev && (pindex->IsProofOfStake() != fProofOfStake))
1459  pindex = pindex->pprev;
1460  return pindex;
1461 }

1463 bool IsInitialBlockDownload()
1464 {
1465  LOCK(cs_main);
1466  if (pindexBest == NULL || nBestHeight < Checkpoints::GetTotalBlocksEstimate())
1467  return true;
1468  static int64_t nLastUpdate;
1469  static CBlockIndex* pindexLastBest;
1470  if (pindexBest != pindexLastBest)
1471  {
1472  pindexLastBest = pindexBest;
1473  nLastUpdate = GetTime();
1474  }
1475  return (GetTime() - nLastUpdate < 15 &&
1476  pindexBest->GetBlockTime() < GetTime() - 8 * 60 * 60);
1477 }

1479 void static InvalidChainFound(CBlockIndex* pindexNew)
1480 {
1481  if (pindexNew->nChainTrust > nBestInvalidTrust)
1482  {
1483  nBestInvalidTrust = pindexNew->nChainTrust;
1484  CTxDB().WriteBestInvalidTrust(nBestInvalidTrust);
1485  }
1486 
1487  uint256 nBestInvalidBlockTrust = pindexNew->nChainTrust - pindexNew->pprev->nChainTrust;
1488  uint256 nBestBlockTrust = pindexBest->nHeight != 0 ? (pindexBest->nChainTrust - pindexBest->pprev->nChainTrust) : pindexBest->nChainTrust;
1489 
1490  LogPrintf("InvalidChainFound: invalid block=%s height=%d trust=%s blocktrust=%d date=%s\n",
1491  pindexNew->GetBlockHash().ToString(), pindexNew->nHeight,
1492  pindexNew->nChainTrust.ToString(), nBestInvalidBlockTrust.Get64(),
1493  DateTimeStrFormat("%x %H:%M:%S", pindexNew->GetBlockTime()));
1494  LogPrintf("InvalidChainFound: current best=%s height=%d trust=%s blocktrust=%d date=%s\n",
1495  hashBestChain.ToString(), nBestHeight,
1496  pindexBest->nChainTrust.ToString(),
1497  nBestBlockTrust.Get64(),
1498  DateTimeStrFormat("%x %H:%M:%S", pindexBest->GetBlockTime()));
1499 }

1507 bool IsConfirmedInNPrevBlocks(const CTxIndex& txindex, const CBlockIndex* pindexFrom, int nMaxDepth, int& nActualDepth)
1508 {
1509  for (const CBlockIndex* pindex = pindexFrom; pindex && pindexFrom->nHeight - pindex->nHeight < nMaxDepth; pindex = pindex->pprev)
1510  {
1511  if (pindex->nBlockPos == txindex.pos.nBlockPos && pindex->nFile == txindex.pos.nFile)
1512  {
1513  nActualDepth = pindexFrom->nHeight - pindex->nHeight;
1514  return true;
1515  }
1516  }
1517  return false;
1518 }

1520 bool CTransaction::DisconnectInputs(CTxDB& txdb)
1521 {
1522  // Relinquish previous transactions' spent pointers
1523  if (!IsCoinBase())
1524  {
1525  BOOST_FOREACH(const CTxIn& txin, vin)
1526  {
1527  COutPoint prevout = txin.prevout;
1528 
1529  // Get prev txindex from disk
1530  CTxIndex txindex;
1531  if (!txdb.ReadTxIndex(prevout.hash, txindex))
1532  return error("DisconnectInputs() : ReadTxIndex failed");
1533 
1534  if (prevout.n >= txindex.vSpent.size())
1535  return error("DisconnectInputs() : prevout.n out of range");
1536 
1537  // Mark outpoint as not spent
1538  txindex.vSpent[prevout.n].SetNull();
1539 
1540  // Write back
1541  if (!txdb.UpdateTxIndex(prevout.hash, txindex))
1542  return error("DisconnectInputs() : UpdateTxIndex failed");
1543  }
1544  }
1545 
1546  // Remove transaction from index
1547  // This can fail if a duplicate of this transaction was in a chain that got
1548  // reorganized away. This is only possible if this transaction was completely
1549  // spent, so erasing it would be a no-op anyway.
1550  txdb.EraseTxIndex(*this);
1551 
1552  return true;
1553 }
1554 
1555 
1556 bool CTransaction::FetchInputs(CTxDB& txdb, const map<uint256, CTxIndex>& mapTestPool,
1557  bool fBlock, bool fMiner, MapPrevTx& inputsRet, bool& fInvalid)
1558 {
1559  // FetchInputs can return false either because we just haven't seen some inputs
1560  // (in which case the transaction should be stored as an orphan)
1561  // or because the transaction is malformed (in which case the transaction should
1562  // be dropped). If tx is definitely invalid, fInvalid will be set to true.
1563  fInvalid = false;
1564 
1565  if (IsCoinBase())
1566  return true; // Coinbase transactions have no inputs to fetch.
1567 
1568  for (unsigned int i = 0; i < vin.size(); i++)
1569  {
1570  COutPoint prevout = vin[i].prevout;
1571  if (inputsRet.count(prevout.hash))
1572  continue; // Got it already
1573 
1574  // Read txindex
1575  CTxIndex& txindex = inputsRet[prevout.hash].first;
1576  bool fFound = true;
1577  if ((fBlock || fMiner) && mapTestPool.count(prevout.hash))
1578  {
1579  // Get txindex from current proposed changes
1580  txindex = mapTestPool.find(prevout.hash)->second;
1581  }
1582  else
1583  {
1584  // Read txindex from txdb
1585  fFound = txdb.ReadTxIndex(prevout.hash, txindex);
1586  }
1587  if (!fFound && (fBlock || fMiner))
1588  return fMiner ? false : error("FetchInputs() : %s prev tx %s index entry not found", GetHash().ToString(), prevout.hash.ToString());
1589 
1590  // Read txPrev
1591  CTransaction& txPrev = inputsRet[prevout.hash].second;
1592  if (!fFound || txindex.pos == CDiskTxPos(1,1,1))
1593  {
1594  // Get prev tx from single transactions in memory
1595  if (!mempool.lookup(prevout.hash, txPrev))
1596  return error("FetchInputs() : %s mempool Tx prev not found %s", GetHash().ToString(), prevout.hash.ToString());
1597  if (!fFound)
1598  txindex.vSpent.resize(txPrev.vout.size());
1599  }
1600  else
1601  {
1602  // Get prev tx from disk
1603  if (!txPrev.ReadFromDisk(txindex.pos))
1604  return error("FetchInputs() : %s ReadFromDisk prev tx %s failed", GetHash().ToString(), prevout.hash.ToString());
1605  }
1606  }
1607 
1608  // Make sure all prevout.n indexes are valid:
1609  for (unsigned int i = 0; i < vin.size(); i++)
1610  {
1611  const COutPoint prevout = vin[i].prevout;
1612  assert(inputsRet.count(prevout.hash) != 0);
1613  const CTxIndex& txindex = inputsRet[prevout.hash].first;
1614  const CTransaction& txPrev = inputsRet[prevout.hash].second;
1615  if (prevout.n >= txPrev.vout.size() || prevout.n >= txindex.vSpent.size())
1616  {
1617  // Revisit this if/when transaction replacement is implemented and allows
1618  // adding inputs:
1619  fInvalid = true;
1620  return DoS(100, error("FetchInputs() : %s prevout.n out of range %d %u %u prev tx %s\n%s", GetHash().ToString(), prevout.n, txPrev.vout.size(), txindex.vSpent.size(), prevout.hash.ToString(), txPrev.ToString()));
1621  }
1622  }
1623 
1624 
1625 
1626  return true;
1627 }
1628 
1629 const CTxOut& CTransaction::GetOutputFor(const CTxIn& input, const MapPrevTx& inputs) const
1630 {
1631  MapPrevTx::const_iterator mi = inputs.find(input.prevout.hash);
1632  if (mi == inputs.end())
1633  throw std::runtime_error("CTransaction::GetOutputFor() : prevout.hash not found");
1634 
1635  const CTransaction& txPrev = (mi->second).second;
1636  if (input.prevout.n >= txPrev.vout.size())
1637  throw std::runtime_error("CTransaction::GetOutputFor() : prevout.n out of range");
1638 
1639  return txPrev.vout[input.prevout.n];
1640 }
