1642 int64_t CTransaction::GetValueIn(const MapPrevTx& inputs) const
1643 {
1644  if (IsCoinBase())
1645  return 0;
1646 
1647  int64_t nResult = 0;
1648  for (unsigned int i = 0; i < vin.size(); i++)
1649  {
1650  nResult += GetOutputFor(vin[i], inputs).nValue;
1651  }
1652  return nResult;
1653 
1654 }
1655 
1656 bool CTransaction::ConnectInputs(CTxDB& txdb, MapPrevTx inputs, map<uint256, CTxIndex>& mapTestPool, const CDiskTxPos& posThisTx,
1657  const CBlockIndex* pindexBlock, bool fBlock, bool fMiner, unsigned int flags, bool fValidateSig)
1658 {
1659  // Take over previous transactions' spent pointers
1660  // fBlock is true when this is called from AcceptBlock when a new best-block is added to the blockchain
1661  // fMiner is true when called from the internal ion miner
1662  // ... both are false when called from CTransaction::AcceptToMemoryPool
1663  if (!IsCoinBase())
1664  {
1665  CAmount nValueIn = 0;
1666  CAmount nFees = 0;
1667  for (unsigned int i = 0; i < vin.size(); i++)
1668  {
1669  COutPoint prevout = vin[i].prevout;
1670  assert(inputs.count(prevout.hash) > 0);
1671  CTxIndex& txindex = inputs[prevout.hash].first;
1672  CTransaction& txPrev = inputs[prevout.hash].second;
1673 
1674  if (prevout.n >= txPrev.vout.size() || prevout.n >= txindex.vSpent.size())
1675  return DoS(100, error("ConnectInputs() : %s prevout.n out of range %d %u %u prev tx %s\n%s", GetHash().ToString(), prevout.n, txPrev.vout.size(), txindex.vSpent.size(), prevout.hash.ToString(), txPrev.ToString()));
1676 
1677  // If prev is coinbase or coinstake, check that it's matured
1678  if (txPrev.IsCoinBase() || txPrev.IsCoinStake())
1679  {
1680  int nSpendDepth;
1681  if (IsConfirmedInNPrevBlocks(txindex, pindexBlock, DetermineCoinbaseMaturity(), nSpendDepth)){
1682  return error("ConnectInputs() : tried to spend %s at depth %d", txPrev.IsCoinBase() ? "coinbase" : "coinstake", nSpendDepth);
1683  }
1684  }
1685  // ion: check transaction timestamp
1686  if (txPrev.nTime > nTime)
1687  return DoS(100, error("ConnectInputs() : transaction timestamp earlier than input transaction"));
1688 
1689  // Check for negative or overflow input values
1690  nValueIn += txPrev.vout[prevout.n].nValue;
1691  if (!MoneyRange(txPrev.vout[prevout.n].nValue) || !MoneyRange(nValueIn))
1692  return DoS(100, error("ConnectInputs() : txin values out of range"));
1693 
1694  }
1695  // The first loop above does all the inexpensive checks.
1696  // Only if ALL inputs pass do we perform expensive ECDSA signature checks.
1697  // Helps prevent CPU exhaustion attacks.
1698  for (unsigned int i = 0; i < vin.size(); i++)
1699  {
1700  COutPoint prevout = vin[i].prevout;
1701  assert(inputs.count(prevout.hash) > 0);
1702  CTxIndex& txindex = inputs[prevout.hash].first;
1703  CTransaction& txPrev = inputs[prevout.hash].second;
1704 
1705  // Check for conflicts (double-spend)
1706  // This doesn't trigger the DoS code on purpose; if it did, it would make it easier
1707  // for an attacker to attempt to split the network.
1708  if (!txindex.vSpent[prevout.n].IsNull())
1709  return fMiner ? false : error("ConnectInputs() : %s prev tx already used at %s", GetHash().ToString(), txindex.vSpent[prevout.n].ToString());
1710 
1711  if(fValidateSig)
1712  {
1713  // Skip ECDSA signature verification when connecting blocks (fBlock=true)
1714  // before the last blockchain checkpoint. This is safe because block merkle hashes are
1715  // still computed and checked, and any change will be caught at the next checkpoint.
1716  if (!(fBlock && !IsInitialBlockDownload()))
1717  {
1718  // Verify signature
1719  if (!VerifySignature(txPrev, *this, i, flags, 0))
1720  {
1721  if (flags & STANDARD_NOT_MANDATORY_VERIFY_FLAGS) {
1722  // Check whether the failure was caused by a
1723  // non-mandatory script verification check, such as
1724  // non-null dummy arguments;
1725  // if so, don't trigger DoS protection to
1726  // avoid splitting the network between upgraded and
1727  // non-upgraded nodes.
1728  if (VerifySignature(txPrev, *this, i, flags & ~STANDARD_NOT_MANDATORY_VERIFY_FLAGS, 0))
1729  return error("ConnectInputs() : %s non-mandatory VerifySignature failed", GetHash().ToString());
1730  }
1731  // Failures of other flags indicate a transaction that is
1732  // invalid in new blocks, e.g. a invalid P2SH. We DoS ban
1733  // such nodes as they are not following the protocol. That
1734  // said during an upgrade careful thought should be taken
1735  // as to the correct behavior - we may want to continue
1736  // peering with non-upgraded nodes even after a soft-fork
1737  // super-majority vote has passed.
1738  return DoS(100,error("ConnectInputs() : %s VerifySignature failed", GetHash().ToString()));
1739  }
1740  }
1741  }
1742 
1743  // Mark outpoints as spent
1744  txindex.vSpent[prevout.n] = posThisTx;
1745 
1746  // Write back
1747  if (fBlock || fMiner)
1748  {
1749  mapTestPool[prevout.hash] = txindex;
1750  }
1751  }
1752 
1753  if (!IsCoinStake())
1754  {
1755  if (nValueIn < GetValueOut())
1756  return DoS(100, error("ConnectInputs() : %s value in < value out", GetHash().ToString()));
1757 
1758  // Tally transaction fees
1759  int64_t nTxFee = nValueIn - GetValueOut();
1760  if (nTxFee < 0)
1761  return DoS(100, error("ConnectInputs() : %s nTxFee < 0", GetHash().ToString()));
1762 
1763  nFees += nTxFee;
1764  if (!MoneyRange(nFees))
1765  return DoS(100, error("ConnectInputs() : nFees out of range"));
1766  }
1767  }
1768 
1769  return true;
1770 }
1771 
1772 bool CBlock::DisconnectBlock(CTxDB& txdb, CBlockIndex* pindex)
1773 {
1774  // Disconnect in reverse order
1775  for (int i = vtx.size()-1; i >= 0; i--)
1776  if (!vtx[i].DisconnectInputs(txdb))
1777  return false;
1778 
1779  // Update block index on disk without changing it in memory.
1780  // The memory index structure will be changed after the db commits.
1781  if (pindex->pprev)
1782  {
1783  CDiskBlockIndex blockindexPrev(pindex->pprev);
1784  blockindexPrev.hashNext = 0;
1785  if (!txdb.WriteBlockIndex(blockindexPrev))
1786  return error("DisconnectBlock() : WriteBlockIndex failed");
1787  }
1788 
1789  // ion: clean up wallet after disconnecting coinstake
1790  BOOST_FOREACH(CTransaction& tx, vtx)
1791  SyncWithWallets(tx, this, false);
1792 
1793  return true;
1794 }
1795 
1796 bool static BuildAddrIndex(const CScript &script, std::vector<uint160>& addrIds)
1797 {
1798  CScript::const_iterator pc = script.begin();
1799  CScript::const_iterator pend = script.end();
1800  std::vector<unsigned char> data;
1801  opcodetype opcode;
1802  bool fHaveData = false;
1803  while (pc < pend) {
1804  script.GetOp(pc, opcode, data);
1805  if (0 <= opcode && opcode <= OP_PUSHDATA4 && data.size() >= 8) { // data element
1806  uint160 addrid = 0;
1807  if (data.size() <= 20) {
1808  memcpy(&addrid, &data[0], data.size());
1809  } else {
1810  addrid = Hash160(data);
1811  }
1812  addrIds.push_back(addrid);
1813  fHaveData = true;
1814  }
1815  }
1816  if (!fHaveData) {
1817  uint160 addrid = Hash160(script);
1818  addrIds.push_back(addrid);
1819  return true;
1820  }
1821  else
1822  {
1823  if(addrIds.size() > 0)
1824  return true;
1825  else
1826  return false;
1827  }
1828 }
1829 
1830 bool FindTransactionsByDestination(const CTxDestination &dest, std::vector<uint256> &vtxhash) {
1831  uint160 addrid = 0;
1832  const CKeyID *pkeyid = boost::get<CKeyID>(&dest);
1833  if (pkeyid)
1834  addrid = static_cast<uint160>(*pkeyid);
1835  if (!addrid) {
1836  const CScriptID *pscriptid = boost::get<CScriptID>(&dest);
1837  if (pscriptid)
1838  addrid = static_cast<uint160>(*pscriptid);
1839  }
1840  if (!addrid)
1841  {
1842  LogPrintf("FindTransactionsByDestination(): Couldn't parse dest into addrid\n");
1843  return false;
1844  }
1845 
1846  LOCK(cs_main);
1847  CTxDB txdb("r");
1848  if(!txdb.ReadAddrIndex(addrid, vtxhash))
1849  {
1850  LogPrintf("FindTransactionsByDestination(): txdb.ReadAddrIndex failed\n");
1851  return false;
1852  }
1853  return true;
1854 }
1855 
1856 void CBlock::RebuildAddressIndex(CTxDB& txdb)
1857 {
1858  BOOST_FOREACH(CTransaction& tx, vtx)
1859  {
1860  uint256 hashTx = tx.GetHash();
1861  // inputs
1862  if(!tx.IsCoinBase())
1863  {
1864  MapPrevTx mapInputs;
1865  map<uint256, CTxIndex> mapQueuedChangesT;
1866  bool fInvalid;
1867  if (!tx.FetchInputs(txdb, mapQueuedChangesT, true, false, mapInputs, fInvalid))
1868  return;
1869 
1870  MapPrevTx::const_iterator mi;
1871  for(MapPrevTx::const_iterator mi = mapInputs.begin(); mi != mapInputs.end(); ++mi)
1872  {
1873  BOOST_FOREACH(const CTxOut &atxout, (*mi).second.second.vout)
1874  {
1875  std::vector<uint160> addrIds;
1876  if(BuildAddrIndex(atxout.scriptPubKey, addrIds))
1877  {
1878  BOOST_FOREACH(uint160 addrId, addrIds)
1879  {
1880  if(!txdb.WriteAddrIndex(addrId, hashTx))
1881  LogPrintf("RebuildAddressIndex(): txins WriteAddrIndex failed addrId: %s txhash: %s\n", addrId.ToString().c_str(), hashTx.ToString().c_str());
1882  }
1883  }
1884  }
1885  }
1886  }
1887  // outputs
1888  BOOST_FOREACH(const CTxOut &atxout, tx.vout) {
1889  std::vector<uint160> addrIds;
1890  if(BuildAddrIndex(atxout.scriptPubKey, addrIds))
1891  {
1892  BOOST_FOREACH(uint160 addrId, addrIds)
1893  {
1894  if(!txdb.WriteAddrIndex(addrId, hashTx))
1895  LogPrintf("RebuildAddressIndex(): txouts WriteAddrIndex failed addrId: %s txhash: %s\n", addrId.ToString().c_str(), hashTx.ToString().c_str());
1896  }
1897  }
1898  }
1899  }
1900 }
1901 
1902 bool CBlock::ConnectBlock(CTxDB& txdb, CBlockIndex* pindex, bool fJustCheck)
1903 {
1904  // Check it again in case a previous version let a bad block in, but skip BlockSig checking
1905  if (!CheckBlock(!fJustCheck, !fJustCheck, false))
1906  return false;
1907 
1908  unsigned int flags = SCRIPT_VERIFY_NOCACHE;
1909 
1911  unsigned int nTxPos;
1912  if (fJustCheck)
1913  // FetchInputs treats CDiskTxPos(1,1,1) as a special "refer to memorypool" indicator
1914  // Since we're just checking the block and not actually connecting it, it might not (and probably shouldn't) be on the disk to get the transaction from
1915  nTxPos = 1;
1916  else
1917  nTxPos = pindex->nBlockPos + ::GetSerializeSize(CBlock(), SER_DISK, CLIENT_VERSION) - (2 * GetSizeOfCompactSize(0)) + GetSizeOfCompactSize(vtx.size());
1918 
1919  map<uint256, CTxIndex> mapQueuedChanges;
1920  CAmount nFees = 0;
1921  CAmount nValueIn = 0;
1922  CAmount nValueOut = 0;
1923  int64_t nStakeReward = 0;
1924  unsigned int nSigOps = 0;
1925  int nInputs = 0;
1926 
1927  BOOST_FOREACH(CTransaction& tx, vtx)
1928  {
1929  uint256 hashTx = tx.GetHash();
1930  nInputs += tx.vin.size();
1931  nSigOps += GetLegacySigOpCount(tx);
1932 
1933  if (nSigOps > MAX_BLOCK_SIGOPS)
1934  return DoS(100, error("ConnectBlock() : too many sigops"));
1935 
1936  CDiskTxPos posThisTx(pindex->nFile, pindex->nBlockPos, nTxPos);
1937  if (!fJustCheck)
1938  nTxPos += ::GetSerializeSize(tx, SER_DISK, CLIENT_VERSION);
1939 
1940  MapPrevTx mapInputs;
1941  if (tx.IsCoinBase())
1942  nValueOut += tx.GetValueOut();
1943  else
1944  {
1945  bool fInvalid;
1946  if (!tx.FetchInputs(txdb, mapQueuedChanges, true, false, mapInputs, fInvalid))
1947  return false;
1948 
1949  // Add in sigops done by pay-to-script-hash inputs;
1950  // this is to prevent a "rogue miner" from creating
1951  // an incredibly-expensive-to-validate block.
1952  nSigOps += GetP2SHSigOpCount(tx, mapInputs);
1953  if (nSigOps > MAX_BLOCK_SIGOPS)
1954  return DoS(100, error("ConnectBlock() : too many sigops"));
1955 
1956  int64_t nTxValueIn = tx.GetValueIn(mapInputs);
1957  int64_t nTxValueOut = tx.GetValueOut();
1958  nValueIn += nTxValueIn;
1959  nValueOut += nTxValueOut;
1960  if (!tx.IsCoinStake())
1961  nFees += nTxValueIn - nTxValueOut;
1962  if (tx.IsCoinStake())
1963  nStakeReward = nTxValueOut - nTxValueIn;
1964 
1965 
1966  if (!tx.ConnectInputs(txdb, mapInputs, mapQueuedChanges, posThisTx, pindex, true, false, flags))
1967  return false;
1968  }
1969 
1970  mapQueuedChanges[hashTx] = CTxIndex(posThisTx, tx.vout.size());
1971  }
1972 
1973  if (IsProofOfWork())
1974  {
1975  int64_t nReward = GetCoinbaseValue(pindex->nHeight, nFees);
1976  // Check coinbase reward
1977  if (vtx[0].GetValueOut() > nReward)
1978  return DoS(50, error("ConnectBlock() : coinbase reward exceeded (actual=%d vs calculated=%d)",
1979  vtx[0].GetValueOut(),
1980  nReward));
1981  }
1982  if (IsProofOfStake())
1983  {
1984  // ion: coin stake tx earns reward instead of paying fee
1985  uint64_t nCoinAge;
1986  if (!vtx[1].GetCoinAge(txdb, pindex->pprev, nCoinAge))
1987  return error("ConnectBlock() : %s unable to get coin age for coinstake", vtx[1].GetHash().ToString());
1988 
1989  int64_t nCalculatedStakeReward = GetCoinstakeValue(nCoinAge, nFees, pindex->nHeight);
1990 
1991  if (nStakeReward > nCalculatedStakeReward)
1992  return DoS(100, error("ConnectBlock() : coinstake pays too much(actual=%d vs calculated=%d)", nStakeReward, nCalculatedStakeReward));
1993  }
1994 
1995  // ion: track money supply and mint amount info
1996  pindex->nMint = nValueOut - nValueIn + nFees;
1997  pindex->nMoneySupply = (pindex->pprev? pindex->pprev->nMoneySupply : 0) + nValueOut - nValueIn;
1998  if (!txdb.WriteBlockIndex(CDiskBlockIndex(pindex)))
1999  return error("Connect() : WriteBlockIndex for pindex failed");
2000 
2001  if (fJustCheck)
2002  return true;
2003 
2004  // Write queued txindex changes
2005  for (map<uint256, CTxIndex>::iterator mi = mapQueuedChanges.begin(); mi != mapQueuedChanges.end(); ++mi)
2006  {
2007  if (!txdb.UpdateTxIndex((*mi).first, (*mi).second))
2008  return error("ConnectBlock() : UpdateTxIndex failed");
2009  }
2010 
2011  if(GetBoolArg("-addrindex", false))
2012  {
2013  // Write Address Index
2014  BOOST_FOREACH(CTransaction& tx, vtx)
2015  {
2016  uint256 hashTx = tx.GetHash();
2017  // inputs
2018  if(!tx.IsCoinBase())
2019  {
2020  MapPrevTx mapInputs;
2021  map<uint256, CTxIndex> mapQueuedChangesT;
2022  bool fInvalid;
2023  if (!tx.FetchInputs(txdb, mapQueuedChangesT, true, false, mapInputs, fInvalid))
2024  return false;
2025 
2026  MapPrevTx::const_iterator mi;
2027  for(MapPrevTx::const_iterator mi = mapInputs.begin(); mi != mapInputs.end(); ++mi)
2028  {
2029  BOOST_FOREACH(const CTxOut &atxout, (*mi).second.second.vout)
2030  {
2031  std::vector<uint160> addrIds;
2032  if(BuildAddrIndex(atxout.scriptPubKey, addrIds))
2033  {
2034  BOOST_FOREACH(uint160 addrId, addrIds)
2035  {
2036  if(!txdb.WriteAddrIndex(addrId, hashTx))
2037  LogPrintf("ConnectBlock(): txins WriteAddrIndex failed addrId: %s txhash: %s\n", addrId.ToString().c_str(), hashTx.ToString().c_str());
2038  }
2039  }
2040  }
2041  }
2042  }
2043 
2044  // outputs
2045  BOOST_FOREACH(const CTxOut &atxout, tx.vout)
2046  {
2047  std::vector<uint160> addrIds;
2048  if(BuildAddrIndex(atxout.scriptPubKey, addrIds))
2049  {
2050  BOOST_FOREACH(uint160 addrId, addrIds)
2051  {
2052  if(!txdb.WriteAddrIndex(addrId, hashTx))
2053  LogPrintf("ConnectBlock(): txouts WriteAddrIndex failed addrId: %s txhash: %s\n", addrId.ToString().c_str(), hashTx.ToString().c_str());
2054  }
2055  }
2056  }
2057  }
2058  }
2059 
2060  // Update block index on disk without changing it in memory.
2061  // The memory index structure will be changed after the db commits.
2062  if (pindex->pprev)
2063  {
2064  CDiskBlockIndex blockindexPrev(pindex->pprev);
2065  blockindexPrev.hashNext = pindex->GetBlockHash();
2066  if (!txdb.WriteBlockIndex(blockindexPrev))
2067  return error("ConnectBlock() : WriteBlockIndex failed");
2068  }
2069 
2070  // Watch for transactions paying to me
2071  BOOST_FOREACH(CTransaction& tx, vtx)
2072  SyncWithWallets(tx, this);
2073 
2074 
2075 
2076 
2077  return true;
2078 }
2079 
2080 bool static Reorganize(CTxDB& txdb, CBlockIndex* pindexNew)
2081 {
2082  LogPrintf("REORGANIZE\n");
2083 
2084  // Find the fork
2085  CBlockIndex* pfork = pindexBest;
2086  CBlockIndex* plonger = pindexNew;
2087  while (pfork != plonger)
2088  {
2089  while (plonger->nHeight > pfork->nHeight)
2090  if (!(plonger = plonger->pprev))
2091  return error("Reorganize() : plonger->pprev is null");
2092  if (pfork == plonger)
2093  break;
2094  if (!(pfork = pfork->pprev))
2095  return error("Reorganize() : pfork->pprev is null");
2096  }
2097 
2098  // List of what to disconnect
2099  vector<CBlockIndex*> vDisconnect;
2100  for (CBlockIndex* pindex = pindexBest; pindex != pfork; pindex = pindex->pprev)
2101  vDisconnect.push_back(pindex);
2102 
2103  // List of what to connect
2104  vector<CBlockIndex*> vConnect;
2105  for (CBlockIndex* pindex = pindexNew; pindex != pfork; pindex = pindex->pprev)
2106  vConnect.push_back(pindex);
2107  reverse(vConnect.begin(), vConnect.end());
2108 
2109  LogPrintf("REORGANIZE: Disconnect %u blocks; %s..%s\n", vDisconnect.size(), pfork->GetBlockHash().ToString(), pindexBest->GetBlockHash().ToString());
2110  LogPrintf("REORGANIZE: Connect %u blocks; %s..%s\n", vConnect.size(), pfork->GetBlockHash().ToString(), pindexNew->GetBlockHash().ToString());
2111 
2112  // Disconnect shorter branch
2113  list<CTransaction> vResurrect;
2114  BOOST_FOREACH(CBlockIndex* pindex, vDisconnect)
2115  {
2116  CBlock block;
2117  if (!block.ReadFromDisk(pindex))
2118  return error("Reorganize() : ReadFromDisk for disconnect failed");
2119  if (!block.DisconnectBlock(txdb, pindex))
2120  return error("Reorganize() : DisconnectBlock %s failed", pindex->GetBlockHash().ToString());
2121 
2122  // Queue memory transactions to resurrect.
2123  // We only do this for blocks after the last checkpoint (reorganisation before that
2124  // point should only happen with -reindex/-loadblock, or a misbehaving peer.
2125  BOOST_REVERSE_FOREACH(const CTransaction& tx, block.vtx)
2126  if (!(tx.IsCoinBase() || tx.IsCoinStake()) && pindex->nHeight > Checkpoints::GetTotalBlocksEstimate())
2127  vResurrect.push_front(tx);
2128  }
2129 
2130  // Connect longer branch
2131  vector<CTransaction> vDelete;
2132  for (unsigned int i = 0; i < vConnect.size(); i++)
2133  {
2134  CBlockIndex* pindex = vConnect[i];
2135  CBlock block;
2136  if (!block.ReadFromDisk(pindex))
2137  return error("Reorganize() : ReadFromDisk for connect failed");
2138  if (!block.ConnectBlock(txdb, pindex))
2139  {
2140  // Invalid block
2141  return error("Reorganize() : ConnectBlock %s failed", pindex->GetBlockHash().ToString());
2142  }
2143 
2144  // Queue memory transactions to delete
2145  BOOST_FOREACH(const CTransaction& tx, block.vtx)
2146  vDelete.push_back(tx);
2147  }
2148  if (!txdb.WriteHashBestChain(pindexNew->GetBlockHash()))
2149  return error("Reorganize() : WriteHashBestChain failed");
2150 
2151  // Make sure it's successfully written to disk before changing memory structure
2152  if (!txdb.TxnCommit())
2153  return error("Reorganize() : TxnCommit failed");
2154 
2155  // Disconnect shorter branch
2156  BOOST_FOREACH(CBlockIndex* pindex, vDisconnect)
2157  if (pindex->pprev)
2158  pindex->pprev->pnext = NULL;
2159 
2160  // Connect longer branch
2161  BOOST_FOREACH(CBlockIndex* pindex, vConnect)
2162  if (pindex->pprev)
2163  pindex->pprev->pnext = pindex;
2164 
2165  // Resurrect memory transactions that were in the disconnected branch
2166  BOOST_FOREACH(CTransaction& tx, vResurrect)
2167  AcceptToMemoryPool(mempool, tx, false, NULL);
2168 
2169  // Delete redundant memory transactions that are in the connected branch
2170  BOOST_FOREACH(CTransaction& tx, vDelete) {
2171  mempool.remove(tx);
2172  mempool.removeConflicts(tx);
2173  }
2174 
2175  LogPrintf("REORGANIZE: done\n");
2176 
2177  return true;
2178 }
2179 
2180 
2181 // Called from inside SetBestChain: attaches a block to the new best chain being built
2182 bool CBlock::SetBestChainInner(CTxDB& txdb, CBlockIndex *pindexNew)
2183 {
2184  uint256 hash = GetHash();
2185 
2186  // Adding to current best branch
2187  if (!ConnectBlock(txdb, pindexNew) || !txdb.WriteHashBestChain(hash))
2188  {
2189  txdb.TxnAbort();
2190  InvalidChainFound(pindexNew);
2191  return false;
2192  }
2193  if (!txdb.TxnCommit())
2194  return error("SetBestChain() : TxnCommit failed");
2195 
2196  // Add to current best branch
2197  pindexNew->pprev->pnext = pindexNew;
2198 
2199  // Delete redundant memory transactions
2200  BOOST_FOREACH(CTransaction& tx, vtx)
2201  mempool.remove(tx);
2202 
2203  return true;
2204 }
2205 
2206 bool CBlock::SetBestChain(CTxDB& txdb, CBlockIndex* pindexNew)
2207 {
2208  uint256 hash = GetHash();
2209 
2210  if (!txdb.TxnBegin())
2211  return error("SetBestChain() : TxnBegin failed");
2212 
2213  if (pindexGenesisBlock == NULL && hash == Params().HashGenesisBlock())
2214  {
2215  txdb.WriteHashBestChain(hash);
2216  if (!txdb.TxnCommit())
2217  return error("SetBestChain() : TxnCommit failed");
2218  pindexGenesisBlock = pindexNew;
2219  }
2220  else if (hashPrevBlock == hashBestChain)
2221  {
2222  if (!SetBestChainInner(txdb, pindexNew))
2223  return error("SetBestChain() : SetBestChainInner failed");
2224  }
2225  else
2226  {
2227  // the first block in the new chain that will cause it to become the new best chain
2228  CBlockIndex *pindexIntermediate = pindexNew;
2229 
2230  // list of blocks that need to be connected afterwards
2231  std::vector<CBlockIndex*> vpindexSecondary;
2232 
2233  // Reorganize is costly in terms of db load, as it works in a single db transaction.
2234  // Try to limit how much needs to be done inside
2235  while (pindexIntermediate->pprev && pindexIntermediate->pprev->nChainTrust > pindexBest->nChainTrust)
2236  {
2237  vpindexSecondary.push_back(pindexIntermediate);
2238  pindexIntermediate = pindexIntermediate->pprev;
2239  }
2240 
2241  if (!vpindexSecondary.empty())
2242  LogPrintf("Postponing %u reconnects\n", vpindexSecondary.size());
2243 
2244  // Switch to new best branch
2245  if (!Reorganize(txdb, pindexIntermediate))
2246  {
2247  txdb.TxnAbort();
2248  InvalidChainFound(pindexNew);
2249  return error("SetBestChain() : Reorganize failed");
2250  }
2251 
2252  // Connect further blocks
2253  BOOST_REVERSE_FOREACH(CBlockIndex *pindex, vpindexSecondary)
2254  {
2255  CBlock block;
2256  if (!block.ReadFromDisk(pindex))
2257  {
2258  LogPrintf("SetBestChain() : ReadFromDisk failed\n");
2259  break;
2260  }
2261  if (!txdb.TxnBegin()) {
2262  LogPrintf("SetBestChain() : TxnBegin 2 failed\n");
2263  break;
2264  }
2265  // errors now are not fatal, we still did a reorganisation to a new chain in a valid way
2266  if (!block.SetBestChainInner(txdb, pindex))
2267  break;
2268  }
2269  }
2270 
2271  // Update best block in wallet (so we can detect restored wallets)
2272  bool fIsInitialDownload = IsInitialBlockDownload();
2273  if ((pindexNew->nHeight % 20160) == 0 || (!fIsInitialDownload && (pindexNew->nHeight % 144) == 0))
2274  {
2275  const CBlockLocator locator(pindexNew);
2276  g_signals.SetBestChain(locator);
2277  }
2278 
2279  // New best block
2280  hashBestChain = hash;
2281  pindexBest = pindexNew;
2282  pblockindexFBBHLast = NULL;
2283  nBestHeight = pindexBest->nHeight;
2284  nBestChainTrust = pindexNew->nChainTrust;
2285  nTimeBestReceived = GetTime();
2286  mempool.AddTransactionsUpdated(1);
2287 
2288  uint256 nBestBlockTrust = pindexBest->nHeight != 0 ? (pindexBest->nChainTrust - pindexBest->pprev->nChainTrust) : pindexBest->nChainTrust;
2289 
2290  LogPrintf("SetBestChain: new best=%s height=%d trust=%s blocktrust=%d date=%s\n",
2291  hashBestChain.ToString(), nBestHeight,
2292  nBestChainTrust.ToString(),
2293  nBestBlockTrust.Get64(),
2294  DateTimeStrFormat("%x %H:%M:%S", pindexBest->GetBlockTime()));
2295 
2296  // Check the version of the last 100 blocks to see if we need to upgrade:
2297  if (!fIsInitialDownload)
2298  {
2299  int nUpgraded = 0;
2300  const CBlockIndex* pindex = pindexBest;
2301  for (int i = 0; i < 100 && pindex != NULL; i++)
2302  {
2303  if (pindex->nVersion > CBlock::CURRENT_VERSION)
2304  ++nUpgraded;
2305  pindex = pindex->pprev;
2306  }
2307  if (nUpgraded > 0)
2308  LogPrintf("SetBestChain: %d of last 100 blocks above version %d\n", nUpgraded, (int)CBlock::CURRENT_VERSION);
2309  if (nUpgraded > 100/2)
2310  // strMiscWarning is read by GetWarnings(), called by Qt and the JSON-RPC code to warn the user:
2311  strMiscWarning = _("Warning: This version is obsolete, upgrade required!");
2312  }
2313 
2314  std::string strCmd = GetArg("-blocknotify", "");
2315 
2316  if (!fIsInitialDownload && !strCmd.empty())
2317  {
2318  boost::replace_all(strCmd, "%s", hashBestChain.GetHex());
2319  boost::thread t(runCommand, strCmd); // thread runs free
2320  }
2321 
2322 
2323 
2324 
2325  return true;
2326 }
2327 
2328 // ion: total coin age spent in transaction, in the unit of coin-days.
2329 // Only those coins meeting minimum age requirement counts. As those
2330 // transactions not in main chain are not currently indexed so we
2331 // might not find out about their coin age. Older transactions are
2332 // guaranteed to be in main chain by sync-checkpoint. This rule is
2333 // introduced to help nodes establish a consistent view of the coin
2334 // age (trust score) of competing branches.
2335 bool CTransaction::GetCoinAge(CTxDB& txdb, const CBlockIndex* pindexPrev, uint64_t& nCoinAge) const
2336 {
2337  uint256 bnCentSecond = 0; // coin age in the unit of cent-seconds
2338  nCoinAge = 0;
2339 
2340  if (IsCoinBase())
2341  return true;
2342 
2343  BOOST_FOREACH(const CTxIn& txin, vin)
2344  {
2345  // First try finding the previous transaction in database
2346  CTransaction txPrev;
2347  CTxIndex txindex;
2348  if (!txPrev.ReadFromDisk(txdb, txin.prevout, txindex))
2349  continue; // previous transaction not in main chain
2350  if (nTime < txPrev.nTime)
2351  return false; // Transaction timestamp violation
2352 
2353  int nSpendDepth;
2354 
2355  if (IsConfirmedInNPrevBlocks(txindex, pindexPrev, DetermineCoinbaseMaturity() - 1, nSpendDepth))
2356  {
2357  LogPrint("coinage", "coin age skip nSpendDepth=%d\n", nSpendDepth + 1);
2358  continue; // only count coins meeting min confirmations requirement
2359  }
2360 
2361  CAmount nValueIn = txPrev.vout[txin.prevout.n].nValue;
2362  bnCentSecond += nValueIn * (nTime-txPrev.nTime) / CENT;
2363 
2364  LogPrint("coinage", "coin age nValueIn=%d nTimeDiff=%d bnCentSecond=%s\n", nValueIn, nTime - txPrev.nTime, bnCentSecond.ToString());
2365  }
2366 
2367  uint256 bnCoinDay = bnCentSecond * CENT / COIN / (24 * 60 * 60);
2368  LogPrint("coinage", "coin age bnCoinDay=%s\n", bnCoinDay.ToString());
2369  nCoinAge = bnCoinDay.GetLow64();
2370  return true;
2371 }
2372 
2373 bool CBlock::AddToBlockIndex(unsigned int nFile, unsigned int nBlockPos, const uint256& hashProof)
2374 {
2375  AssertLockHeld(cs_main);
2376 
2377  // Check for duplicate
2378  uint256 hash = GetHash();
2379  if (mapBlockIndex.count(hash))
2380  return error("AddToBlockIndex() : %s already exists", hash.ToString());
2381 
2382  // Construct new block index object
2383  CBlockIndex* pindexNew = new CBlockIndex(nFile, nBlockPos, *this);
2384  {
2385  LOCK(cs_nBlockSequenceId);
2386  pindexNew->nSequenceId = nBlockSequenceId++;
2387  }
2388  if (!pindexNew)
2389  return error("AddToBlockIndex() : new CBlockIndex failed");
2390  pindexNew->phashBlock = &hash;
2391  map<uint256, CBlockIndex*>::iterator miPrev = mapBlockIndex.find(hashPrevBlock);
2392  if (miPrev != mapBlockIndex.end())
2393  {
2394  pindexNew->pprev = (*miPrev).second;
2395  pindexNew->nHeight = pindexNew->pprev->nHeight + 1;
2396  }
2397 
2398  // ion: compute chain trust score
2399  pindexNew->nChainTrust = (pindexNew->pprev ? pindexNew->pprev->nChainTrust : 0) + pindexNew->GetBlockTrust();
2400 
2401  // ion: compute stake entropy bit for stake modifier
2402  if (!pindexNew->SetStakeEntropyBit(GetStakeEntropyBit()))
2403  return error("AddToBlockIndex() : SetStakeEntropyBit() failed");
2404 
2405  // Record proof hash value
2406  pindexNew->hashProof = hashProof;
2407 
2408  // ion: compute stake modifier
2409  uint64_t nStakeModifier = 0;
2410  bool fGeneratedStakeModifier = false;
2411  if (!ComputeNextStakeModifier(pindexNew->pprev, nStakeModifier, fGeneratedStakeModifier))
2412  return error("AddToBlockIndex() : ComputeNextStakeModifier() failed");
2413  pindexNew->SetStakeModifier(nStakeModifier, fGeneratedStakeModifier);
2414  pindexNew->bnStakeModifierV2 = ComputeStakeModifierV2(pindexNew->pprev, IsProofOfWork() ? hash : vtx[1].vin[0].prevout.hash);
2415 
2416  // Add to mapBlockIndex
2417  map<uint256, CBlockIndex*>::iterator mi = mapBlockIndex.insert(make_pair(hash, pindexNew)).first;
2418  if (pindexNew->IsProofOfStake())
2419  setStakeSeen.insert(make_pair(pindexNew->prevoutStake, pindexNew->nStakeTime));
2420  pindexNew->phashBlock = &((*mi).first);
2421 
2422  // Write to disk block index
2423  CTxDB txdb;
2424  if (!txdb.TxnBegin())
2425  return false;
2426  txdb.WriteBlockIndex(CDiskBlockIndex(pindexNew));
2427  if (!txdb.TxnCommit())
2428  return false;
2429 
2430  // New best
2431  if (pindexNew->nChainTrust > nBestChainTrust)
2432  if (!SetBestChain(txdb, pindexNew))
2433  return false;
2434 
2435  if (pindexNew == pindexBest)
2436  {
2437  // Notify UI to display prev block's coinbase if it was ours
2438  static uint256 hashPrevBestCoinBase;
2439  g_signals.UpdatedTransaction(hashPrevBestCoinBase);
2440  hashPrevBestCoinBase = vtx[0].GetHash();
2441  }
2442 
2443 
2444 
2445 
2446 
2447 
2448  return true;
2449 }
2450 
2451 bool CBlock::CheckBlock(bool fCheckPOW, bool fCheckMerkleRoot, bool fCheckSig) const
2452 {
2453  // These are checks that are independent of context
2454  // that can be verified before saving an orphan block.
2455 
2456  // Size limits
2457  if (vtx.empty() || vtx.size() > MAX_BLOCK_SIZE || ::GetSerializeSize(*this, SER_NETWORK, PROTOCOL_VERSION) > MAX_BLOCK_SIZE)
2458  return DoS(100, error("CheckBlock() : size limits failed"));
2459 
2460  // Check proof of work matches claimed amount
2461  if (fCheckPOW && IsProofOfWork() && !CheckProofOfWork(GetPoWHash(), nBits))
2462  return DoS(50, error("CheckBlock() : proof of work failed"));
2463 
2464  // Check timestamp
2465  if (GetBlockTime() > FutureDriftV2(GetAdjustedTime()))
2466  return error("CheckBlock() : block timestamp too far in the future");
2467 
2468  // First transaction must be coinbase, the rest must not be
2469  if (vtx.empty() || !vtx[0].IsCoinBase())
2470  return DoS(100, error("CheckBlock() : first tx is not coinbase"));
2471  for (unsigned int i = 1; i < vtx.size(); i++)
2472  if (vtx[i].IsCoinBase())
2473  return DoS(100, error("CheckBlock() : more than one coinbase"));
2474 
2475  if (IsProofOfStake())
2476  {
2477  // Coinbase output should be empty if proof-of-stake block
2478  if (vtx[0].vout.size() != 1 || !vtx[0].vout[0].IsEmpty())
2479  return DoS(100, error("CheckBlock() : coinbase output not empty for proof-of-stake block"));
2480 
2481  // Second transaction must be coinstake, the rest must not be
2482  if (vtx.empty() || !vtx[1].IsCoinStake())
2483  return DoS(100, error("CheckBlock() : second tx is not coinstake"));
2484  for (unsigned int i = 2; i < vtx.size(); i++)
2485  if (vtx[i].IsCoinStake())
2486  return DoS(100, error("CheckBlock() : more than one coinstake"));
2487  }
2488 
2489  // Check proof-of-stake block signature
2490  if (fCheckSig && !CheckBlockSignature())
2491  return DoS(100, error("CheckBlock() : bad proof-of-stake block signature"));
2492 
2493 
2494 // ----------- instantX transaction scanning -----------
2495 
2496  if(IsSporkActive(SPORK_3_INSTANTX_BLOCK_FILTERING)){
2497  BOOST_FOREACH(const CTransaction& tx, vtx){
2498  if (!tx.IsCoinBase()){
2499  //only reject blocks when it's based on complete consensus
2500  BOOST_FOREACH(const CTxIn& in, tx.vin){
2501  if(mapLockedInputs.count(in.prevout)){
2502  if(mapLockedInputs[in.prevout] != tx.GetHash()){
2503  if(fDebug) { LogPrintf("CheckBlock() : found conflicting transaction with transaction lock %s %s\n", mapLockedInputs[in.prevout].ToString().c_str(), tx.GetHash().ToString().c_str()); }
2504  return DoS(0, error("CheckBlock() : found conflicting transaction with transaction lock"));
2505  }
2506  }
2507  }
2508  }
2509  }
2510  } else{
2511  if(fDebug) { LogPrintf("CheckBlock() : skipping transaction locking checks\n"); }
2512  }
2513 
2514 
2515 
2516  // ----------- masternode payments -----------
2517 
2518  bool MasternodePayments = true;
2519  bool fIsInitialDownload = IsInitialBlockDownload();
2520 
2521  if (!fIsInitialDownload)
2522  {
2523  if(MasternodePayments)
2524  {
2525  LOCK2(cs_main, mempool.cs);
2526 
2527  CBlockIndex *pindex = pindexBest;
2528  if(IsProofOfStake() && pindex != NULL){
2529  if(pindex->GetBlockHash() == hashPrevBlock){
2530  // If we don't already have its previous block, skip masternode payment step
2531  CAmount masternodePaymentAmount;
2532  for (int i = vtx[1].vout.size(); i--> 0; ) {
2533  masternodePaymentAmount = vtx[1].vout[i].nValue;
2534  break;
2535  }
2536  bool foundPaymentAmount = false;
2537  bool foundPayee = false;
2538  bool foundPaymentAndPayee = false;
2539 
2540  CScript payee;
2541  CTxIn vin;
2542  if(!masternodePayments.GetBlockPayee(pindexBest->nHeight+1, payee, vin) || payee == CScript()){
2543  foundPayee = true; //doesn't require a specific payee
2544  foundPaymentAmount = true;
2545  foundPaymentAndPayee = true;
2546  if(fDebug) { LogPrintf("CheckBlock() : Using non-specific masternode payments %d\n", pindexBest->nHeight+1); }
2547  }
2548 
2549  for (unsigned int i = 0; i < vtx[1].vout.size(); i++) {
2550  if(vtx[1].vout[i].nValue == masternodePaymentAmount )
2551  foundPaymentAmount = true;
2552  if(vtx[1].vout[i].scriptPubKey == payee )
2553  foundPayee = true;
2554  if(vtx[1].vout[i].nValue == masternodePaymentAmount && vtx[1].vout[i].scriptPubKey == payee)
2555  foundPaymentAndPayee = true;
2556  }
2557 
2558  CTxDestination address1;
2559  ExtractDestination(payee, address1);
2560  CIonAddress address2(address1);
2561 
2562  if(!foundPaymentAndPayee) {
2563  if(fDebug) { LogPrintf("CheckBlock() : Couldn't find masternode payment(%d|%d) or payee(%d|%s) nHeight %d. \n", foundPaymentAmount, masternodePaymentAmount, foundPayee, address2.ToString().c_str(), pindexBest->nHeight+1); }
2564  return DoS(100, error("CheckBlock() : Couldn't find masternode payment or payee"));
2565  } else {
2566  LogPrintf("CheckBlock() : Found payment(%d|%d) or payee(%d|%s) nHeight %d. \n", foundPaymentAmount, masternodePaymentAmount, foundPayee, address2.ToString().c_str(), pindexBest->nHeight+1);
2567  }
2568  } else {
2569  if(fDebug) { LogPrintf("CheckBlock() : Skipping masternode payment check - nHeight %d Hash %s\n", pindexBest->nHeight+1, GetHash().ToString().c_str()); }
2570  }
2571  } else {
2572  if(fDebug) { LogPrintf("CheckBlock() : pindex is null, skipping masternode payment check\n"); }
2573  }
2574  } else {
2575  if(fDebug) { LogPrintf("CheckBlock() : skipping masternode payment checks\n"); }
2576  }
2577  } else {
2578  if(fDebug) { LogPrintf("CheckBlock() : Is initial download, skipping masternode payment check %d\n", pindexBest->nHeight+1); }
2579  }
2580 
2581 
2582 
2583 
2584 
2585 
2586 
2587 
2588 
2589  // Check transactions
2590  BOOST_FOREACH(const CTransaction& tx, vtx)
2591  {
2592  if (!tx.CheckTransaction())
2593  return DoS(tx.nDoS, error("CheckBlock() : CheckTransaction failed"));
2594 
2595  // ion: check transaction timestamp
2596  if (GetBlockTime() < (int64_t)tx.nTime)
2597  return DoS(50, error("CheckBlock() : block timestamp earlier than transaction timestamp"));
2598  }
2599 
2600  // Check for duplicate txids. This is caught by ConnectInputs(),
2601  // but catching it earlier avoids a potential DoS attack:
2602  set<uint256> uniqueTx;
2603  BOOST_FOREACH(const CTransaction& tx, vtx)
2604  {
2605  uniqueTx.insert(tx.GetHash());
2606  }
2607  if (uniqueTx.size() != vtx.size())
2608  return DoS(100, error("CheckBlock() : duplicate transaction"));
2609 
2610  unsigned int nSigOps = 0;
2611  BOOST_FOREACH(const CTransaction& tx, vtx)
2612  {
2613  nSigOps += GetLegacySigOpCount(tx);
2614  }
2615  if (nSigOps > MAX_BLOCK_SIGOPS)
2616  return DoS(100, error("CheckBlock() : out-of-bounds SigOpCount"));
2617 
2618  // Check merkle root
2619  if (fCheckMerkleRoot && hashMerkleRoot != BuildMerkleTree())
2620  return DoS(100, error("CheckBlock() : hashMerkleRoot mismatch"));
2621 
2622 
2623  return true;
2624 }
2625 
2626 bool CBlock::AcceptBlock()
2627 {
2628  AssertLockHeld(cs_main);
2629 
2630  // Remove for BIP-0034 FORK
2631  if (nVersion > CURRENT_VERSION)
2632  return DoS(100, error("AcceptBlock() : reject unknown block version %d", nVersion));
2633 
2634  // Check for duplicate
2635  uint256 hash = GetHash();
2636  if (mapBlockIndex.count(hash))
2637  return error("AcceptBlock() : block already in mapBlockIndex");
2638 
2639  // Get prev block index
2640  map<uint256, CBlockIndex*>::iterator mi = mapBlockIndex.find(hashPrevBlock);
2641  if (mi == mapBlockIndex.end())
2642  return DoS(10, error("AcceptBlock() : prev block not found"));
2643  CBlockIndex* pindexPrev = (*mi).second;
2644  int nHeight = pindexPrev->nHeight+1;
2645 
2646  uint256 hashProof;
2647  if (IsProofOfWork() && nHeight > Params().LastPOWBlock()){
2648  return DoS(100, error("AcceptBlock() : reject proof-of-work at height %d", nHeight));
2649  } else {
2650  // PoW is checked in CheckBlock()
2651  if (IsProofOfWork())
2652  {
2653  hashProof = GetPoWHash();
2654  }
2655  }
2656 
2657  // Check coinbase timestamp
2658  if (GetBlockTime() > FutureDrift((int64_t)vtx[0].nTime, nHeight) && IsProofOfStake())
2659  return DoS(50, error("AcceptBlock() : coinbase timestamp is too early"));
2660 
2661  // Check coinstake timestamp
2662  if (IsProofOfStake() && !CheckCoinStakeTimestamp(nHeight, GetBlockTime(), (int64_t)vtx[1].nTime))
2663  return DoS(50, error("AcceptBlock() : coinstake timestamp violation nTimeBlock=%d nTimeTx=%u", GetBlockTime(), vtx[1].nTime));
2664 
2665  // Check proof-of-work or proof-of-stake
2666  if (nBits != GetNextTargetRequired(pindexPrev, IsProofOfStake()))
2667  return DoS(100, error("AcceptBlock() : incorrect %s", IsProofOfWork() ? "proof-of-work" : "proof-of-stake"));
2668 
2669  // Check timestamp against prev
2670  if ((nHeight > Params().Fork1Height()) &&
2671  (FutureDrift(GetBlockTime(), nHeight) < pindexPrev->GetBlockTime())){
2672  return error("AcceptBlock() : block's timestamp is too far in the future");
2673  }
2674 
2675  if ((nHeight > Params().Fork1Height()) &&
2676  ((GetBlockTime() <= pindexPrev->GetMedianTimePast()))){
2677  return error("AcceptBlock() : block's timestamp is too early");
2678  }
2679 
2680  // Check that all transactions are finalized
2681  BOOST_FOREACH(const CTransaction& tx, vtx)
2682  if (!IsFinalTx(tx, nHeight, GetBlockTime()))
2683  return DoS(10, error("AcceptBlock() : contains a non-final transaction"));
2684 
2685  // Check that the block chain matches the known block chain up to a checkpoint
2686  if (!Checkpoints::CheckHardened(nHeight, hash))
2687  return DoS(100, error("AcceptBlock() : rejected by hardened checkpoint lock-in at %d", nHeight));
2688 
2689  // Verify hash target and signature of coinstake tx
2690  if (IsProofOfStake())
2691  {
2692  uint256 targetProofOfStake;
2693  if (!CheckProofOfStake(pindexPrev, vtx[1], nBits, hashProof, targetProofOfStake))
2694  {
2695  return error("AcceptBlock() : check proof-of-stake failed for block %s", hash.ToString());
2696  }
2697  }
2698 
2699  // Check that the block satisfies synchronized checkpoint
2700  if (!Checkpoints::CheckSync(nHeight))
2701  return error("AcceptBlock() : rejected by synchronized checkpoint");
2702 
2703  // Enforce rule that the coinbase starts with serialized block height
2704  CScript expect = CScript() << nHeight;
2705  if (vtx[0].vin[0].scriptSig.size() < expect.size() ||
2706  !std::equal(expect.begin(), expect.end(), vtx[0].vin[0].scriptSig.begin()))
2707  return DoS(100, error("AcceptBlock() : block height mismatch in coinbase"));
2708 
2709  // Write block to history file
2710  if (!CheckDiskSpace(::GetSerializeSize(*this, SER_DISK, CLIENT_VERSION)))
2711  return error("AcceptBlock() : out of disk space");
2712  unsigned int nFile = -1;
2713  unsigned int nBlockPos = 0;
2714  if (!WriteToDisk(nFile, nBlockPos))
2715  return error("AcceptBlock() : WriteToDisk failed");
2716  if (!AddToBlockIndex(nFile, nBlockPos, hashProof))
2717  return error("AcceptBlock() : AddToBlockIndex failed");
2718 
2719  // Relay inventory, but don't relay old inventory during initial block download
2720  int nBlockEstimate = Checkpoints::GetTotalBlocksEstimate();
2721  if (hashBestChain == hash)
2722  {
2723  LOCK(cs_vNodes);
2724  BOOST_FOREACH(CNode* pnode, vNodes)
2725  if (nBestHeight > (pnode->nStartingHeight != -1 ? pnode->nStartingHeight - 2000 : nBlockEstimate))
2726  pnode->PushInventory(CInv(MSG_BLOCK, hash));
2727  }
2728 
2729  return true;
2730 }
2731 
2732 uint256 CBlockIndex::GetBlockTrust() const
2733 {
2734  uint256 bnTarget;
2735  bnTarget.SetCompact(nBits);
2736 
2737  if (bnTarget == 0)
2738  return 0;
2739 
2740  // We need to compute 2**256 / (bnTarget+1), but we can't represent 2**256
2741  // as it's too large for a uint256. However, as 2**256 is at least as large
2742  // as bnTarget+1, it is equal to ((2**256 - bnTarget - 1) / (bnTarget+1)) + 1,
2743  // or ~bnTarget / (nTarget+1) + 1.
2744 
2745  return (~bnTarget / (bnTarget + 1)) + 1;
2746 }
2747 
2748 void PushGetBlocks(CNode* pnode, CBlockIndex* pindexBegin, uint256 hashEnd)
2749 {
2750  // Filter out duplicate requests
2751  if (pindexBegin == pnode->pindexLastGetBlocksBegin && hashEnd == pnode->hashLastGetBlocksEnd)
2752  return;
2753  pnode->pindexLastGetBlocksBegin = pindexBegin;
2754  pnode->hashLastGetBlocksEnd = hashEnd;
2755 
2756  pnode->PushMessage("getblocks", CBlockLocator(pindexBegin), hashEnd);
2757 }
2758 
2759 bool static IsCanonicalBlockSignature(CBlock* pblock)
2760 {
2761  if (pblock->IsProofOfWork()) {
2762  return pblock->vchBlockSig.empty();
2763  }
2764 
2765  return IsDERSignature(pblock->vchBlockSig, false);
2766 }
2767 
2768 void Misbehaving(NodeId pnode, int howmuch)
2769 {
2770  if (howmuch == 0)
2771  return;
2772 
2773  CNodeState *state = State(pnode);
2774  if (state == NULL)
2775  return;
2776 
2777  state->nMisbehavior += howmuch;
2778  if (state->nMisbehavior >= GetArg("-banscore", 100))
2779  {
2780  LogPrintf("Misbehaving: %s (%d -> %d) BAN THRESHOLD EXCEEDED\n", state->name.c_str(), state->nMisbehavior-howmuch, state->nMisbehavior);
2781  state->fShouldBan = true;
2782  } else
2783  LogPrintf("Misbehaving: %s (%d -> %d)\n", state->name.c_str(), state->nMisbehavior-howmuch, state->nMisbehavior);
2784 }
2785 
2786 bool ProcessBlock(CNode* pfrom, CBlock* pblock)
2787 {
2788  AssertLockHeld(cs_main);
2789 
2790  // Check for duplicate
2791  uint256 hash = pblock->GetHash();
2792  if (mapBlockIndex.count(hash))
2793  return error("ProcessBlock() : already have block %d %s", mapBlockIndex[hash]->nHeight, hash.ToString());
2794  if (mapOrphanBlocks.count(hash))
2795  return error("ProcessBlock() : already have block (orphan) %s", hash.ToString());
2796 
2797  // ion: check proof-of-stake
2798  // Limited duplicity on stake: prevents block flood attack
2799  // Duplicate stake allowed only when there is orphan child block
2800  if (!fReindex && !fImporting && pblock->IsProofOfStake() && setStakeSeen.count(pblock->GetProofOfStake()) && !mapOrphanBlocksByPrev.count(hash))
2801  return error("ProcessBlock() : duplicate proof-of-stake (%s, %d) for block %s", pblock->GetProofOfStake().first.ToString(), pblock->GetProofOfStake().second, hash.ToString());
2802 
2803 
2804 
2805 
2806  if (pblock->hashPrevBlock != hashBestChain)
2807  {
2808  // Extra checks to prevent "fill up memory by spamming with bogus blocks"
2809  const CBlockIndex* pcheckpoint = Checkpoints::AutoSelectSyncCheckpoint();
2810  int64_t deltaTime = pblock->GetBlockTime() - pcheckpoint->nTime;
2811  if (deltaTime < 0)
2812  {
2813  if (pfrom)
2814  Misbehaving(pfrom->GetId(), 1);
2815  return error("ProcessBlock() : block with timestamp before last checkpoint");
2816  }
2817  }
2818 
2819  // Block signature can be malleated in such a way that it increases block size up to maximum allowed by protocol
2820  // For now we just strip garbage from newly received blocks
2821  if (!IsCanonicalBlockSignature(pblock)) {
2822  return error("ProcessBlock(): bad block signature encoding");
2823  }
2824 
2825  // Preliminary checks
2826  if (!pblock->CheckBlock())
2827  return error("ProcessBlock() : CheckBlock FAILED");
2828 
2829  // If we don't already have its previous block, shunt it off to holding area until we get it
2830  if (!mapBlockIndex.count(pblock->hashPrevBlock))
2831  {
2832  LogPrintf("ProcessBlock: ORPHAN BLOCK %lu, prev=%s\n", (unsigned long)mapOrphanBlocks.size(), pblock->hashPrevBlock.ToString());
2833 
2834  // Accept orphans as long as there is a node to request its parents from
2835  if (pfrom) {
2836  // ion: check proof-of-stake
2837  if (pblock->IsProofOfStake())
2838  {
2839  // Limited duplicity on stake: prevents block flood attack
2840  // Duplicate stake allowed only when there is orphan child block
2841  if (setStakeSeenOrphan.count(pblock->GetProofOfStake()) && !mapOrphanBlocksByPrev.count(hash))
2842  return error("ProcessBlock() : duplicate proof-of-stake (%s, %d) for orphan block %s", pblock->GetProofOfStake().first.ToString(), pblock->GetProofOfStake().second, hash.ToString());
2843  }
2844  PruneOrphanBlocks();
2845  COrphanBlock* pblock2 = new COrphanBlock();
2846  {
2847  CDataStream ss(SER_DISK, CLIENT_VERSION);
2848  ss << *pblock;
2849  pblock2->vchBlock = std::vector<unsigned char>(ss.begin(), ss.end());
2850  }
2851  pblock2->hashBlock = hash;
2852  pblock2->hashPrev = pblock->hashPrevBlock;
2853  pblock2->stake = pblock->GetProofOfStake();
2854  mapOrphanBlocks.insert(make_pair(hash, pblock2));
2855  mapOrphanBlocksByPrev.insert(make_pair(pblock2->hashPrev, pblock2));
2856  if (pblock->IsProofOfStake())
2857  setStakeSeenOrphan.insert(pblock->GetProofOfStake());
2858 
2859  // Ask this guy to fill in what we're missing
2860  PushGetBlocks(pfrom, pindexBest, GetOrphanRoot(hash));
2861  // ion: getblocks may not obtain the ancestor block rejected
2862  // earlier by duplicate-stake check so we ask for it again directly
2863  if (!IsInitialBlockDownload())
2864  pfrom->AskFor(CInv(MSG_BLOCK, WantedByOrphan(pblock2)));
2865  }
2866  return true;
2867  }
2868 
2869  // Store to disk
2870  if (!pblock->AcceptBlock())
2871  return error("ProcessBlock() : AcceptBlock FAILED");
2872 
2873  // Recursively process any orphan blocks that depended on this one
2874  vector<uint256> vWorkQueue;
2875  vWorkQueue.push_back(hash);
2876  for (unsigned int i = 0; i < vWorkQueue.size(); i++)
2877  {
2878  uint256 hashPrev = vWorkQueue[i];
2879  for (multimap<uint256, COrphanBlock*>::iterator mi = mapOrphanBlocksByPrev.lower_bound(hashPrev);
2880  mi != mapOrphanBlocksByPrev.upper_bound(hashPrev);
2881  ++mi)
2882  {
2883  CBlock block;
2884  {
2885  CDataStream ss(mi->second->vchBlock, SER_DISK, CLIENT_VERSION);
2886  ss >> block;
2887  }
2888  block.BuildMerkleTree();
2889  if (block.AcceptBlock())
2890  vWorkQueue.push_back(mi->second->hashBlock);
2891  mapOrphanBlocks.erase(mi->second->hashBlock);
2892  setStakeSeenOrphan.erase(block.GetProofOfStake());
2893  delete mi->second;
2894  }
2895  mapOrphanBlocksByPrev.erase(hashPrev);
2896  }
2897 
2898  if(!IsInitialBlockDownload()){
2899 
2900  CScript payee;
2901  CTxIn vin;
2902 
2903  // If we're in LiteMode disable stashedsend features without disabling masternodes
2904  if (!fLiteMode && !fImporting && !fReindex && pindexBest->nHeight > Checkpoints::GetTotalBlocksEstimate()){
2905 
2906  if(masternodePayments.GetBlockPayee(pindexBest->nHeight, payee, vin)){
2907  //UPDATE MASTERNODE LAST PAID TIME
2908  CMasternode* pmn = mnodeman.Find(vin);
2909  if(pmn != NULL) {
2910  pmn->nLastPaid = GetAdjustedTime();
2911  }
2912 
2913  LogPrintf("ProcessBlock() : Update Masternode Last Paid Time - %d\n", pindexBest->nHeight);
2914  }
2915 
2916  stashedSendPool.CheckTimeout();
2917  stashedSendPool.NewBlock();
2918  masternodePayments.ProcessBlock(GetHeight()+10);
2919 
2920  } else if (fLiteMode && !fImporting && !fReindex && pindexBest->nHeight > Checkpoints::GetTotalBlocksEstimate())
2921  {
2922  if(masternodePayments.GetBlockPayee(pindexBest->nHeight, payee, vin)){
2923  //UPDATE MASTERNODE LAST PAID TIME
2924  CMasternode* pmn = mnodeman.Find(vin);
2925  if(pmn != NULL) {
2926  pmn->nLastPaid = GetAdjustedTime();
2927  }
2928 
2929  LogPrintf("ProcessBlock() : Update Masternode Last Paid Time - %d\n", pindexBest->nHeight);
2930  }
2931 
2932  masternodePayments.ProcessBlock(GetHeight()+10);
2933  }
2934 
2935  }
2936 
2937  LogPrintf("ProcessBlock: ACCEPTED\n");
2938 
2939  return true;
2940 }
2941 
2942 #ifdef ENABLE_WALLET
2943 // ion: attempt to generate suitable proof-of-stake
2944 bool CBlock::SignBlock(CWallet& wallet, CAmount nFees)
2945 {
2946  // if we are trying to sign
2947  // something except proof-of-stake block template
2948  if (!vtx[0].vout[0].IsEmpty())
2949  return false;
2950 
2951  // if we are trying to sign
2952  // a complete proof-of-stake block
2953  if (IsProofOfStake())
2954  return true;
2955 
2956  static int64_t nLastCoinStakeSearchTime = GetAdjustedTime(); // startup timestamp
2957 
2958  CKey key;
2959  CTransaction txCoinStake;
2960  txCoinStake.nTime &= ~STAKE_TIMESTAMP_MASK;
2961 
2962  int64_t nSearchTime = txCoinStake.nTime; // search to current time
2963 
2964  if (nSearchTime > nLastCoinStakeSearchTime)
2965  {
2966  int64_t nSearchInterval = 1;
2967  if (wallet.CreateCoinStake(wallet, nBits, nSearchInterval, nFees, txCoinStake, key))
2968  {
2969  if (txCoinStake.nTime >= pindexBest->GetPastTimeLimit()+1)
2970  {
2971  // make sure coinstake would meet timestamp protocol
2972  // as it would be the same as the block timestamp
2973  vtx[0].nTime = nTime = txCoinStake.nTime;
2974 
2975  // we have to make sure that we have no future timestamps in
2976  // our transactions set
2977  for (vector<CTransaction>::iterator it = vtx.begin(); it != vtx.end();)
2978  if (it->nTime > nTime) { it = vtx.erase(it); } else { ++it; }
2979 
2980  vtx.insert(vtx.begin() + 1, txCoinStake);
2981  hashMerkleRoot = BuildMerkleTree();
2982 
2983  // append a signature to our block
2984  return key.Sign(GetHash(), vchBlockSig);
2985  }
2986  }
2987  nLastCoinStakeSearchInterval = nSearchTime - nLastCoinStakeSearchTime;
2988  nLastCoinStakeSearchTime = nSearchTime;
2989  }
2990 
2991  return false;
2992 }
2993 #endif

2998  return vchBlockSig.empty();
2999 
3000  if (vchBlockSig.empty())
3001  return false;

3003  vector<valtype> vSolutions;

3005

3062 static unsigned int nCurrentBlockFile = 1;

3064 FILE* AppendBlockFile(unsigned int& nFileRet)
3065 {
3066  nFileRet = 0;
3067  while (true)
3068  {
3069  FILE* file = OpenBlockFile(nCurrentBlockFile, 0, "ab");
3070  if (!file)
3071  return NULL;
3072  if (fseek(file, 0, SEEK_END) != 0)
3073  return NULL;
3074  // FAT32 file size max 4GB, fseek and ftell max 2GB, so we must stay under 2GB
3075  if (ftell(file) < (long)(0x7F000000 - MAX_SIZE))
3076  {
3077  nFileRet = nCurrentBlockFile;
3078  return file;
3079  }
3080  fclose(file);
3081  nCurrentBlockFile++;
3082  }
3083 }

3119 void PrintBlockTree()
3120 {
3121  AssertLockHeld(cs_main);
3122  // pre-compute tree structure
3123  map<CBlockIndex*, vector<CBlockIndex*> > mapNext;
3124  for (map<uint256, CBlockIndex*>::iterator mi = mapBlockIndex.begin(); mi != mapBlockIndex.end(); ++mi)
3125  {
3126  CBlockIndex* pindex = (*mi).second;
3127  mapNext[pindex->pprev].push_back(pindex);
3128  // test
3129  //while (rand() % 3 == 0)
3130  // mapNext[pindex->pprev].push_back(pindex);
3131  }
3132 
3133  vector<pair<int, CBlockIndex*> > vStack;
3134  vStack.push_back(make_pair(0, pindexGenesisBlock));
3135 
3136  int nPrevCol = 0;
3137  while (!vStack.empty())
3138  {
3139  int nCol = vStack.back().first;
3140  CBlockIndex* pindex = vStack.back().second;
3141  vStack.pop_back();
3142 
3143  // print split or gap
3144  if (nCol > nPrevCol)
3145  {
3146  for (int i = 0; i < nCol-1; i++)
3147  LogPrintf("| ");
3148  LogPrintf("|\\\n");
3149  }
3150  else if (nCol < nPrevCol)
3151  {
3152  for (int i = 0; i < nCol; i++)
3153  LogPrintf("| ");
3154  LogPrintf("|\n");
3155  }
3156  nPrevCol = nCol;
3157 
3158  // print columns
3159  for (int i = 0; i < nCol; i++)
3160  LogPrintf("| ");
3161 
3162  // print item
3163  CBlock block;
3164  block.ReadFromDisk(pindex);
3165  LogPrintf("%d (%u,%u) %s %08x %s mint %7s tx %u",
3166  pindex->nHeight,
3167  pindex->nFile,
3168  pindex->nBlockPos,
3169  block.GetHash().ToString(),
3170  block.nBits,
3171  DateTimeStrFormat("%x %H:%M:%S", block.GetBlockTime()),
3172  FormatMoney(pindex->nMint),
3173  block.vtx.size());
3174 
3175  // put the main time-chain first
3176  vector<CBlockIndex*>& vNext = mapNext[pindex];
3177  for (unsigned int i = 0; i < vNext.size(); i++)
3178  {
3179  if (vNext[i]->pnext)
3180  {
3181  swap(vNext[0], vNext[i]);
3182  break;
3183  }
3184  }
3185 
3186  // iterate children
3187  for (unsigned int i = 0; i < vNext.size(); i++)
3188  vStack.push_back(make_pair(nCol+i, vNext[i]));
3189  }
3190 }

3192 bool LoadExternalBlockFile(FILE* fileIn)
3193 {
3194  int64_t nStart = GetTimeMillis();
3195 
3196  int nLoaded = 0;
3197  {
3198  try {
3199  CAutoFile blkdat(fileIn, SER_DISK, CLIENT_VERSION);
3200  unsigned int nPos = 0;
3201  while (nPos != (unsigned int)-1 && blkdat.good())
3202  {
3203  boost::this_thread::interruption_point();
3204  unsigned char pchData[65536];
3205  do {
3206  fseek(blkdat.Get(), nPos, SEEK_SET);
3207  int nRead = fread(pchData, 1, sizeof(pchData), blkdat.Get());
3208  if (nRead <= 8)
3209  {
3210  nPos = (unsigned int)-1;
3211  break;
3212  }
3213  void* nFind = memchr(pchData, Params().MessageStart()[0], nRead+1-MESSAGE_START_SIZE);
3214  if (nFind)
3215  {
3216  if (memcmp(nFind, Params().MessageStart(), MESSAGE_START_SIZE)==0)
3217  {
3218  nPos += ((unsigned char*)nFind - pchData) + MESSAGE_START_SIZE;
3219  break;
3220  }
3221  nPos += ((unsigned char*)nFind - pchData) + 1;
3222  }
3223  else
3224  nPos += sizeof(pchData) - MESSAGE_START_SIZE + 1;
3225  boost::this_thread::interruption_point();
3226  } while(true);
3227  if (nPos == (unsigned int)-1)
3228  break;
3229  fseek(blkdat.Get(), nPos, SEEK_SET);
3230  unsigned int nSize;
3231  blkdat >> nSize;
3232  if (nSize > 0 && nSize <= MAX_BLOCK_SIZE)
3233  {
3234  CBlock block;
3235  blkdat >> block;
3236  LOCK(cs_main);
3237  if (ProcessBlock(NULL,&block))
3238  {
3239  nLoaded++;
3240  nPos += 4 + nSize;
3241  }
3242  }
3243  }
3244  }
3245  catch (std::exception &e) {
3246  LogPrintf("%s() : Deserialize or I/O error caught during load\n",
3247  __PRETTY_FUNCTION__);
3248  }
3249  }
3250  LogPrintf("Loaded %i blocks from external file in %dms\n", nLoaded, GetTimeMillis() - nStart);
3251  return nLoaded > 0;
3252 }

3365 bool static AlreadyHave(CTxDB& txdb, const CInv& inv)
3366 {

3374  txInMap = mempool.exists(inv.hash);
3375  return txInMap ||
3376  mapOrphanTransactions.count(inv.hash) ||
3377  txdb.ContainsTx(inv.hash);
3378  }
3379 
3380  case MSG_BLOCK:
3381  return mapBlockIndex.count(inv.hash) ||
3382  mapOrphanBlocks.count(inv.hash);
3383  case MSG_TXLOCK_REQUEST:
3384  return mapTxLockReq.count(inv.hash) ||
3385  mapTxLockReqRejected.count(inv.hash);
3386  case MSG_TXLOCK_VOTE:
3387  return mapTxLockVote.count(inv.hash);
3388  case MSG_SPORK:
3389  return mapSporks.count(inv.hash);
3390  case MSG_MASTERNODE_WINNER:
3391  return mapSeenMasternodeVotes.count(inv.hash);
3392  }
3393  // Don't know what it is, just say we already got one
3394  return true;
3395 }

3398 void static ProcessGetData(CNode* pfrom)
3399 {

3401 
3402  vector<CInv> vNotFound;

3404  LOCK(cs_main);
3405 
3406  while (it != pfrom->vRecvGetData.end()) {

3408  if (pfrom->nSendSize >= SendBufferSize())

3410

3412  {

3420  if (mi != mapBlockIndex.end())

3427  if (inv.hash == pfrom->hashContinue)

3430  // and we want it right after the last block so they don't
3431  // wait for other stuff first.
3432  vector<CInv> vInv;
3433  vInv.push_back(CInv(MSG_BLOCK, hashBestChain));
3434  pfrom->PushMessage("inv", vInv);
3435  pfrom->hashContinue = 0;
3436  }
3437  }
3438  }
3439  else if (inv.IsKnownType())
3440  {
3441  if(fDebug) LogPrintf("ProcessGetData -- Starting \n");
3442  // Send stream from relay memory
3443  bool pushed = false;
3444  /*{
3445  LOCK(cs_mapRelay);
3446  map<CInv, CDataStream>::iterator mi = mapRelay.find(inv);
3447  if (mi != mapRelay.end()) {

3458  ss.reserve(1000);
3459  ss << tx;
3460  pfrom->PushMessage("tx", ss);
3461  pushed = true;
3462  }

3511  pushed = true;
3512  }
3513  }
3514  if (!pushed) {
3515  vNotFound.push_back(inv);
3516  }
3517  }
3518 
3519  // Track requests for our stuff.
3520  g_signals.Inventory(inv.hash);
3521 
3522  if (inv.type == MSG_BLOCK || inv.type == MSG_FILTERED_BLOCK)
3523  break;
3524  }
3525  }
3526 
3527  pfrom->vRecvGetData.erase(pfrom->vRecvGetData.begin(), it);
3528 
3529  if (!vNotFound.empty()) {
3530  // Let the peer know that we didn't find what it asked for, so it doesn't
3531  // have to wait around forever. Currently only SPV clients actually care
3532  // about this message: it's needed when they are recursively walking the
3533  // dependencies of relevant unconfirmed transactions. SPV clients want to
3534  // do that because they want to know about (and store and rebroadcast and
3535  // risk analyze) the dependencies of transactions relevant to them, without
3536  // having to download the entire memory pool.
3537  pfrom->PushMessage("notfound", vNotFound);
3538  }

3541 bool static ProcessMessage(CNode* pfrom, string strCommand, CDataStream& vRecv)
3542 {
3543 
3544  RandAddSeedPerfmon();
3545  LogPrint("net", "received: %s (%u bytes)\n", strCommand, vRecv.size());
3546  if (mapArgs.count("-dropmessagestest") && GetRand(atoi(mapArgs["-dropmessagestest"])) == 0)
3547  {
3548  LogPrintf("dropmessagestest DROPPING RECV MESSAGE\n");
3549  return true;
3550  }
3551 
3552  {
3553  LOCK(cs_main);
3554  State(pfrom->GetId())->nLastBlockProcess = GetTimeMicros();
3555  }
3556  if (strCommand == "version")
3557  {
3558  // Each connection can only send one version message
3559  if (pfrom->nVersion != 0)
3560  {
3561  Misbehaving(pfrom->GetId(), 1);
3562  return false;
3563  }
3564 
3565  int64_t nTime;
3566  CAddress addrMe;
3567  CAddress addrFrom;
3568  uint64_t nNonce = 1;
3569  vRecv >> pfrom->nVersion >> pfrom->nServices >> nTime >> addrMe;
3570  if (pfrom->nVersion < MIN_PEER_PROTO_VERSION)
3571  {
3572  // disconnect from peers older than this proto version
3573  LogPrintf("partner %s using obsolete version %i; disconnecting\n", pfrom->addr.ToString(), pfrom->nVersion);
3574  pfrom->fDisconnect = true;
3575  return false;
3576  }
3577 
3578  if (pfrom->nVersion == 10300)
3579  pfrom->nVersion = 300;
3580  if (!vRecv.empty())
3581  vRecv >> addrFrom >> nNonce;
3582  if (!vRecv.empty()) {
3583  vRecv >> pfrom->strSubVer;
3584  pfrom->cleanSubVer = SanitizeString(pfrom->strSubVer);
3585  }
3586  if (!vRecv.empty())
3587  vRecv >> pfrom->nStartingHeight;
3588 
3589  if (!vRecv.empty())
3590  vRecv >> pfrom->fRelayTxes;
3591  else
3592  pfrom->fRelayTxes = true;
3593 
3594  // Disconnect if we connected to ourself
3595  if (nNonce == nLocalHostNonce && nNonce > 1)
3596  {
3597  LogPrintf("connected to self at %s, disconnecting\n", pfrom->addr.ToString());
3598  pfrom->fDisconnect = true;
3599  return true;
3600  }
3601 
3602  if (pfrom->fInbound && addrMe.IsRoutable())
3603  {
3604  pfrom->addrLocal = addrMe;
3605  SeenLocal(addrMe);
3606  }
3607 
3608  // Be shy and don't send version until we hear
3609  if (pfrom->fInbound)
3610  pfrom->PushVersion();
3611 
3612  pfrom->fClient = !(pfrom->nServices & NODE_NETWORK);
3613 
3614  // Change version
3615  pfrom->PushMessage("verack");
3616  pfrom->ssSend.SetVersion(min(pfrom->nVersion, PROTOCOL_VERSION));
3617 
3618  if (!pfrom->fInbound)
3619  {
3620  // Advertise our address
3621  if (!fNoListen && !IsInitialBlockDownload())
3622  {
3623  CAddress addr = GetLocalAddress(&pfrom->addr);
3624  if (addr.IsRoutable())
3625  {
3626  pfrom->PushAddress(addr);
3627  } else if (IsPeerAddrLocalGood(pfrom)) {
3628  addr.SetIP(pfrom->addrLocal);
3629  pfrom->PushAddress(addr);
3630  }
3631  }
3632 
3633  // Get recent addresses

4080  {
4081  if (pfrom->nVersion > BIP0031_VERSION)
4082  {
4083  uint64_t nonce = 0;
4084  vRecv >> nonce;
4085  // Echo the message back with the nonce. This allows for two useful features:
4086  //
4087  // 1) A remote node can quickly check if the connection is operational
4088  // 2) Remote nodes can measure the latency of the network thread. If this node
4089  // is overloaded it won't respond to pings quickly and the remote node can
4090  // avoid sending us more work, like chain download requests.
4091  //
4092  // The nonce stops the remote getting confused between different pings: without
4093  // it, if the remote node sends a ping once per second and this node takes 5
4094  // seconds to respond to each, the 5th ping the remote sends would appear to
4095  // return very quickly.
4096  pfrom->PushMessage("pong", nonce);
4097  }
4098  }

4100 
4101  else if (strCommand == "pong")
4102  {
4103  int64_t pingUsecEnd = GetTimeMicros();
4104  uint64_t nonce = 0;
4105  size_t nAvail = vRecv.in_avail();
4106  bool bPingFinished = false;
4107  std::string sProblem;
4108 
4109  if (nAvail >= sizeof(nonce)) {
4110  vRecv >> nonce;
4111 
4112  // Only process pong message if there is an outstanding ping (old ping without nonce should never pong)
4113  if (pfrom->nPingNonceSent != 0) {
4114  if (nonce == pfrom->nPingNonceSent) {
4115  // Matching pong received, this ping is no longer outstanding
4116  bPingFinished = true;
4117  int64_t pingUsecTime = pingUsecEnd - pfrom->nPingUsecStart;
4118  if (pingUsecTime > 0) {
4119  // Successful ping time measurement, replace previous
4120  pfrom->nPingUsecTime = pingUsecTime;
4121  } else {
4122  // This should never happen
4123  sProblem = "Timing mishap";
4124  }
4125  } else {
4126  // Nonce mismatches are normal when pings are overlapping
4127  sProblem = "Nonce mismatch";
4128  if (nonce == 0) {
4129  // This is most likely a bug in another implementation somewhere, cancel this ping
4130  bPingFinished = true;
4131  sProblem = "Nonce zero";
4132  }
4133  }
4134  } else {
4135  sProblem = "Unsolicited pong without ping";
4136  }
4137  } else {
4138  // This is most likely a bug in another implementation somewhere, cancel this ping
4139  bPingFinished = true;
4140  sProblem = "Short payload";
4141  }
4142 
4143  if (!(sProblem.empty())) {
4144  LogPrint("net", "pong %s %s: %s, %x expected, %x received, %zu bytes\n"
4145  , pfrom->addr.ToString()
4146  , pfrom->strSubVer
4147  , sProblem
4148  , pfrom->nPingNonceSent
4149  , nonce
4150  , nAvail);
4151  }
4152  if (bPingFinished) {
4153  pfrom->nPingNonceSent = 0;
4154  }
4155  }
4156 
4157 
4158  else if (strCommand == "alert")
4159  {
4160  CAlert alert;
4161  vRecv >> alert;
4162 
4163  uint256 alertHash = alert.GetHash();

4165  {
4166  if (alert.ProcessAlert())
4167  {
4168  // Relay
4169  pfrom->setKnown.insert(alertHash);
4170  {
4171  LOCK(cs_vNodes);
4172  BOOST_FOREACH(CNode* pnode, vNodes)
4173  alert.RelayTo(pnode);
4174  }
4175  }
4176  else {
4177  // Small DoS penalty so peers that send us lots of
4178  // duplicate/expired/invalid-signature/whatever alerts
4179  // eventually get banned.
4180  // This isn't a Misbehaving(100) (immediate ban) because the
4181  // peer might be an older or different implementation with
4182  // a different signature key, etc.
4183  Misbehaving(pfrom->GetId(), 10);
4184  }

4194  ProcessMessageInstantX(pfrom, strCommand, vRecv);
4195  ProcessSpork(pfrom, strCommand, vRecv);
4196 
4197 
4198 
4199 
4200  // Ignore unknown commands for extensibility
4201  }
4202 
4203 
4204  // Update the last seen time for this node's address
4205  if (pfrom->fNetworkNode)
4206  if (strCommand == "version" || strCommand == "addr" || strCommand == "inv" || strCommand == "getdata" || strCommand == "ping")
4207  AddressCurrentlyConnected(pfrom->addr);
4208 
4209 
4210  return true;
4211 }
4212 
4213 // requires LOCK(cs_vRecvMsg)
4214 bool ProcessMessages(CNode* pfrom)
4215 {
4216  //if (fDebug)
4217  // LogPrintf("ProcessMessages(%zu messages)\n", pfrom->vRecvMsg.size());
4218 
4219  //
4220  // Message format
4221  // (4) message start
4222  // (12) command
4223  // (4) size
4224  // (4) checksum
4225  // (x) data
4226  //
4227  bool fOk = true;
4228 
4229  if (!pfrom->vRecvGetData.empty())
4230  ProcessGetData(pfrom);
4231 
4232  // this maintains the order of responses
4233  if (!pfrom->vRecvGetData.empty()) return fOk;
4234 
4235  std::deque<CNetMessage>::iterator it = pfrom->vRecvMsg.begin();
4236  while (!pfrom->fDisconnect && it != pfrom->vRecvMsg.end()) {
4237  // Don't bother if send buffer is too full to respond anyway
4238  if (pfrom->nSendSize >= SendBufferSize())
4239  break;
4240 
4241  // get next message
4242  CNetMessage& msg = *it;
4243 
4244  //if (fDebug)
4245  // LogPrintf("ProcessMessages(message %u msgsz, %zu bytes, complete:%s)\n",
4246  // msg.hdr.nMessageSize, msg.vRecv.size(),
4247  // msg.complete() ? "Y" : "N");
4248 
4249  // end, if an incomplete message is found
4250  if (!msg.complete())
4251  break;
4252 
4253  // at this point, any failure means we can delete the current message
4254  it++;
4255 
4256  // Scan for message start
4257  if (memcmp(msg.hdr.pchMessageStart, Params().MessageStart(), MESSAGE_START_SIZE) != 0) {
4258  LogPrintf("\n\nPROCESSMESSAGE: INVALID MESSAGESTART\n\n");
4259  fOk = false;
4260  break;
4261  }
4262 
4263  // Read header
4264  CMessageHeader& hdr = msg.hdr;
4265  if (!hdr.IsValid())
4266  {
4267  LogPrintf("\n\nPROCESSMESSAGE: ERRORS IN HEADER %s\n\n\n", hdr.GetCommand());
4268  continue;
4269  }
4270  string strCommand = hdr.GetCommand();
4271 
4272  // Message size
4273  unsigned int nMessageSize = hdr.nMessageSize;
4274 
4275  // Checksum
4276  CDataStream& vRecv = msg.vRecv;
4277  uint256 hash = Hash(vRecv.begin(), vRecv.begin() + nMessageSize);
4278  unsigned int nChecksum = 0;
4279  memcpy(&nChecksum, &hash, sizeof(nChecksum));
4280  if (nChecksum != hdr.nChecksum)
4281  {
4282  LogPrintf("ProcessMessages(%s, %u bytes) : CHECKSUM ERROR nChecksum=%08x hdr.nChecksum=%08x\n",
4283  strCommand, nMessageSize, nChecksum, hdr.nChecksum);
4284  continue;
4285  }
4286 
4287  // Process message
4288  bool fRet = false;
4289  try
4290  {
4291  fRet = ProcessMessage(pfrom, strCommand, vRecv);
4292  boost::this_thread::interruption_point();
4293  }
4294  catch (std::ios_base::failure& e)
4295  {
4296  if (strstr(e.what(), "end of data"))
4297  {
4298  // Allow exceptions from under-length message on vRecv
4299  LogPrintf("ProcessMessages(%s, %u bytes) : Exception '%s' caught, normally caused by a message being shorter than its stated length\n", strCommand, nMessageSize, e.what());
4300  }
4301  else if (strstr(e.what(), "size too large"))
4302  {
4303  // Allow exceptions from over-long size
4304  LogPrintf("ProcessMessages(%s, %u bytes) : Exception '%s' caught\n", strCommand, nMessageSize, e.what());
4305  }
4306  else
4307  {
4308  PrintExceptionContinue(&e, "ProcessMessages()");
4309  }
4310  }
4311  catch (boost::thread_interrupted) {
4312  throw;
4313  }
4314  catch (std::exception& e) {
4315  PrintExceptionContinue(&e, "ProcessMessages()");
4316  } catch (...) {
4317  PrintExceptionContinue(NULL, "ProcessMessages()");
4318  }
4319 
4320  if (!fRet)
4321  LogPrintf("ProcessMessage(%s, %u bytes) FAILED\n", strCommand, nMessageSize);
4322 
4323  break;
4324  }
4325 
4326  // In case the connection got shut down, its receive buffer was wiped
4327  if (!pfrom->fDisconnect)
4328  pfrom->vRecvMsg.erase(pfrom->vRecvMsg.begin(), it);
4329 
4330  return fOk;
4331 }
4332 
4333 
4334 bool SendMessages(CNode* pto, bool fSendTrickle)
4335 {
4336  TRY_LOCK(cs_main, lockMain);
4337  if (lockMain) {
4338  // Don't send anything until we get their version message
4339  if (pto->nVersion == 0)
4340  return true;
4341 
4342  //
4343  // Message: ping
4344  //
4345  bool pingSend = false;
4346  if (pto->fPingQueued) {
4347  // RPC ping request by user
4348  pingSend = true;
4349  }
4350  if (pto->nPingNonceSent == 0 && pto->nPingUsecStart + PING_INTERVAL * 1000000 < GetTimeMicros()) {
4351  // Ping automatically sent as a latency probe & keepalive.
4352  pingSend = true;
4353  }
4354  if (pingSend) {
4355  uint64_t nonce = 0;
4356  while (nonce == 0) {
4357  GetRandBytes((unsigned char*)&nonce, sizeof(nonce));
4358  }
4359  pto->fPingQueued = false;
4360  pto->nPingUsecStart = GetTimeMicros();
4361  if (pto->nVersion > BIP0031_VERSION) {
4362  pto->nPingNonceSent = nonce;
4363  pto->PushMessage("ping", nonce);
4364  } else {
4365  // Peer is too old to support ping command with nonce, pong will never arrive.
4366  pto->nPingNonceSent = 0;
4367  pto->PushMessage("ping");
4368  }
4369  }
4370 
4371  TRY_LOCK(cs_main, lockMain); // Acquire cs_main for IsInitialBlockDownload() and CNodeState()
4372  if (!lockMain)
4373  return true;
4374 
4375  // Start block sync
4376  if (pto->fStartSync && !fImporting && !fReindex) {
4377  pto->fStartSync = false;
4378  PushGetBlocks(pto, pindexBest, uint256(0));
4379  }
4380 
4381  // Resend wallet transactions that haven't gotten in a block yet
4382  // Except during reindex, importing and IBD, when old wallet
4383  // transactions become unconfirmed and spams other nodes.
4384  if (!fReindex && !fImporting && !IsInitialBlockDownload())
4385  {
4386  ResendWalletTransactions();
4387  }
4388 
4389  // Address refresh broadcast
4390  static int64_t nLastRebroadcast;
4391  if (!IsInitialBlockDownload() && (GetTime() - nLastRebroadcast > 24 * 60 * 60))
4392  {
4393  {
4394  LOCK(cs_vNodes);
4395  BOOST_FOREACH(CNode* pnode, vNodes)
4396  {
4397  // Periodically clear setAddrKnown to allow refresh broadcasts
4398  if (nLastRebroadcast)
4399  pnode->setAddrKnown.clear();
4400 
4401  // Rebroadcast our address
4402  if (!fNoListen)
4403  {
4404  CAddress addr = GetLocalAddress(&pnode->addr);
4405  if (addr.IsRoutable())
4406  pnode->PushAddress(addr);
4407  }
4408  }
4409  }
4410  nLastRebroadcast = GetTime();
4411  }
4412 
4413  //
4414  // Message: addr
4415  //
4416  if (fSendTrickle)
4417  {
4418  vector<CAddress> vAddr;
4419  vAddr.reserve(pto->vAddrToSend.size());
4420  BOOST_FOREACH(const CAddress& addr, pto->vAddrToSend)
4421  {
4422  // returns true if wasn't already contained in the set
4423  if (pto->setAddrKnown.insert(addr).second)
4424  {
4425  vAddr.push_back(addr);
4426  // receiver rejects addr messages larger than 1000
4427  if (vAddr.size() >= 1000)
4428  {
4429  pto->PushMessage("addr", vAddr);
4430  vAddr.clear();
4431  }
4432  }
4433  }
4434  pto->vAddrToSend.clear();
4435  if (!vAddr.empty())
4436  pto->PushMessage("addr", vAddr);
4437  }
4438 
4439  CNodeState &state = *State(pto->GetId());
4440  if (state.fShouldBan) {
4441  if (pto->addr.IsLocal())
4442  LogPrintf("Warning: not banning local node %s!\n", pto->addr.ToString().c_str());
4443  else {
4444  pto->fDisconnect = true;
4445  CNode::Ban(pto->addr, BanReasonNodeMisbehaving);
4446  }
4447  state.fShouldBan = false;
4448  }
4449 
4450  BOOST_FOREACH(const CBlockReject& reject, state.rejects)
4451  pto->PushMessage("reject", (string)"block", reject.chRejectCode, reject.strRejectReason, reject.hashBlock);
4452  state.rejects.clear();
4453 
4454  //
4455  // Message: inventory
4456  //
4457  vector<CInv> vInv;
4458  vector<CInv> vInvWait;
4459  {
4460  LOCK(pto->cs_inventory);
4461  vInv.reserve(pto->vInventoryToSend.size());
4462  vInvWait.reserve(pto->vInventoryToSend.size());
4463  BOOST_FOREACH(const CInv& inv, pto->vInventoryToSend)
4464  {
4465  if (pto->setInventoryKnown.count(inv))
4466  continue;
4467 
4468  // trickle out tx inv to protect privacy
4469  if (inv.type == MSG_TX && !fSendTrickle)
4470  {
4471  // 1/4 of tx invs blast to all immediately
4472  static uint256 hashSalt;
4473  if (hashSalt == 0)
4474  hashSalt = GetRandHash();
4475  uint256 hashRand = inv.hash ^ hashSalt;
4476  hashRand = Hash(BEGIN(hashRand), END(hashRand));
4477  bool fTrickleWait = ((hashRand & 3) != 0);
4478 
4479  if (fTrickleWait)
4480  {
4481  vInvWait.push_back(inv);
4482  continue;
4483  }
4484  }
4485 
4486  // returns true if wasn't already contained in the set
4487  if (pto->setInventoryKnown.insert(inv).second)
4488  {
4489  vInv.push_back(inv);
4490  if (vInv.size() >= 1000)
4491  {
4492  pto->PushMessage("inv", vInv);
4493  vInv.clear();
4494  }
4495  }
4496  }
4497  pto->vInventoryToSend = vInvWait;
4498  }
4499  if (!vInv.empty())
4500  pto->PushMessage("inv", vInv);
4501 
4502  // Detect stalled peers. Require that blocks are in flight, we haven't
4503  // received a (requested) block in one minute, and that all blocks are
4504  // in flight for over two minutes, since we first had a chance to
4505  // process an incoming block.
4506  int64_t nNow = GetTimeMicros();
4507  if (!pto->fDisconnect && state.nBlocksInFlight &&
4508  state.nLastBlockReceive < state.nLastBlockProcess - BLOCK_DOWNLOAD_TIMEOUT*1000000 &&
4509  state.vBlocksInFlight.front().nTime < state.nLastBlockProcess - 2*BLOCK_DOWNLOAD_TIMEOUT*1000000) {
4510  LogPrintf("Peer %s is stalling block download, disconnecting\n", state.name.c_str());
4511  pto->fDisconnect = true;
4512  }
4513 
4514 
4515  //
4516  // Message: getdata (blocks)
4517  //
4518  vector<CInv> vGetData;
4519  CTxDB txdb("r");
4520  while (!pto->fDisconnect && state.nBlocksToDownload && state.nBlocksInFlight < MAX_BLOCKS_IN_TRANSIT_PER_PEER) {
4521  uint256 hash = state.vBlocksToDownload.front();
4522  vGetData.push_back(CInv(MSG_BLOCK, hash));
4523  MarkBlockAsInFlight(pto->GetId(), hash);
4524  LogPrint("net", "Requesting block %s from %s\n", hash.ToString().c_str(), state.name.c_str());
4525  if (vGetData.size() >= 1000)
4526  {
4527  pto->PushMessage("getdata", vGetData);
4528  vGetData.clear();
4529  }
4530  }
4531 
4532  //
4533  // Message: getdata (non-blocks)
4534  //
4535  while (!pto->fDisconnect && !pto->mapAskFor.empty() && (*pto->mapAskFor.begin()).first <= nNow)
4536  {
4537  const CInv& inv = (*pto->mapAskFor.begin()).second;
4538  if (!AlreadyHave(txdb, inv))
4539  {
4540  if (fDebug)
4541  LogPrint("net", "sending getdata: %s\n", inv.ToString());
4542  vGetData.push_back(inv);
4543  if (vGetData.size() >= 1000)
4544  {
4545  pto->PushMessage("getdata", vGetData);
4546  vGetData.clear();
4547  }
4548  } else {
4549  //If we're not going to ask, don't expect a response.
4550  pto->setAskFor.erase(inv.hash);
4551  }
4552  pto->mapAskFor.erase(pto->mapAskFor.begin());
4553  }
4554  if (!vGetData.empty())
4555  pto->PushMessage("getdata", vGetData);
4556  }
4557  return true;
4558 }
